CVE-2007-0002.title: libwpd: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200704-07
CVE-2007-0002.subTitle: libwpd is vulnerable to several heap overflows and an integer overflow.
CVE-2007-0002.background: libwpd is a library used to convert Wordperfect documents into other formats.
CVE-2007-0002.body: libwpd contains heap-based overflows in two functions that convert WordPerfect document tables. In addition, it contains an integer overflow in a text-conversion function.
CVE-2007-0002.extra: An attacker could entice a user to convert a specially crafted WordPerfect file, resulting in a crash or possibly the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running libwpd.

CVE-2007-0008.title: Mozilla Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-18
CVE-2007-0008.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-0008.background: Mozilla Thunderbird is a popular open-source email client from the Mozilla Project.
CVE-2007-0008.body: Georgi Guninski reported a possible integer overflow in the code handling text/enhanced or text/richtext MIME emails. Additionally, various researchers reported errors in the JavaScript engine potentially leading to memory corruption. Additionally, the binary version of Mozilla Thunderbird includes a vulnerable NSS library which contains two possible buffer overflows involving the SSLv2 protocol.
CVE-2007-0008.extra: An attacker could entice a user to read a specially crafted email that could trigger one of the vulnerabilities, some of them being related to Mozilla Thunderbird's handling of JavaScript, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-0009.title: Mozilla Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-18
CVE-2007-0009.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-0009.background: Mozilla Thunderbird is a popular open-source email client from the Mozilla Project.
CVE-2007-0009.body: Georgi Guninski reported a possible integer overflow in the code handling text/enhanced or text/richtext MIME emails. Additionally, various researchers reported errors in the JavaScript engine potentially leading to memory corruption. Additionally, the binary version of Mozilla Thunderbird includes a vulnerable NSS library which contains two possible buffer overflows involving the SSLv2 protocol.
CVE-2007-0009.extra: An attacker could entice a user to read a specially crafted email that could trigger one of the vulnerabilities, some of them being related to Mozilla Thunderbird's handling of JavaScript, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-0044.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200701-16
CVE-2007-0044.subTitle: Adobe Acrobat Reader is vulnerable to remote code execution, Denial of Service, and cross-site scripting attacks.
CVE-2007-0044.background: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a PDF reader released by Adobe.
CVE-2007-0044.body: Adobe Acrobat Reader in stand-alone mode is vulnerable to remote code execution via heap corruption when loading a specially crafted PDF file.
CVE-2007-0044.extra: The browser plugin released with Adobe Acrobat Reader (nppdf.so) does not properly handle URLs, and crashes if given a URL that is too long. The plugin does not correctly handle JavaScript, and executes JavaScript that is given as a GET variable to the URL of a PDF file. Lastly, the plugin does not properly handle the FDF, xml, xfdf AJAX request parameters following the # character in a URL, allowing for multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

CVE-2007-0045.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200701-16
CVE-2007-0045.subTitle: Adobe Acrobat Reader is vulnerable to remote code execution, Denial of Service, and cross-site scripting attacks.
CVE-2007-0045.background: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a PDF reader released by Adobe.
CVE-2007-0045.body: Adobe Acrobat Reader in stand-alone mode is vulnerable to remote code execution via heap corruption when loading a specially crafted PDF file.
CVE-2007-0045.extra: The browser plugin released with Adobe Acrobat Reader (nppdf.so) does not properly handle URLs, and crashes if given a URL that is too long. The plugin does not correctly handle JavaScript, and executes JavaScript that is given as a GET variable to the URL of a PDF file. Lastly, the plugin does not properly handle the FDF, xml, xfdf AJAX request parameters following the # character in a URL, allowing for multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities.

CVE-2007-0061.title: VMware Workstation and Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-23
CVE-2007-0061.subTitle: VMware guest operating systems might be able to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the host operating system through multiple flaws.
CVE-2007-0061.background: VMware Workstation is a virtual machine for developers and system administrators. VMware Player is a freeware virtualization software that can run guests produced by other VMware products.
CVE-2007-0061.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in several VMware products. Neel Mehta and Ryan Smith (IBM ISS X-Force) discovered that the DHCP server contains an integer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2007-0062), an integer underflow vulnerability (CVE-2007-0063) and another error when handling malformed packets (CVE-2007-0061), leading to stack-based buffer overflows or stack corruption. Rafal Wojtczvk (McAfee) discovered two unspecified errors that allow authenticated users with administrative or login privileges on a guest operating system to corrupt memory or cause a Denial of Service (CVE-2007-4496, CVE-2007-4497). Another unspecified vulnerability related to untrusted virtual machine images was discovered (CVE-2007-5617).
CVE-2007-0061.extra: VMware products also shipped code copies of software with several vulnerabilities: Samba (GLSA-200705-15), BIND (GLSA-200702-06), MIT Kerberos 5 (GLSA-200707-11), Vixie Cron (GLSA-200704-11), shadow (GLSA-200606-02), OpenLDAP (CVE-2006-4600), PAM (CVE-2004-0813, CVE-2007-1716), GCC (CVE-2006-3619) and GDB (CVE-2006-4146).

CVE-2007-0062.title: VMware Workstation and Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-23
CVE-2007-0062.subTitle: VMware guest operating systems might be able to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the host operating system through multiple flaws.
CVE-2007-0062.background: VMware Workstation is a virtual machine for developers and system administrators. VMware Player is a freeware virtualization software that can run guests produced by other VMware products.

CVE-2007-0062.title: ISC DHCP: Denial of service — GLSA 200808-05
CVE-2007-0062.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability was discovered in ISC DHCP.
CVE-2007-0062.background: ISC DHCP is ISC's reference implementation of all aspects of the Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol.
CVE-2007-0062.body: A buffer overflow error was found in ISC DHCP server, that can only be exploited under unusual server configurations where the DHCP server is configured to provide clients with a large set of DHCP options.
CVE-2007-0062.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-0235.title: libgtop: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200701-17
CVE-2007-0235.subTitle: libgtop improperly handles filenames, possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-0235.background: libgtop facilitates the libgtop_daemon, which is used by GNOME to obtain information about remote systems.
CVE-2007-0235.body: Liu Qishuai discovered that glibtop_get_proc_map_s() in sysdeps/linux/procmap.c does not properly allocate memory for storing a filename, allowing certain filenames to cause the buffer to overflow on the stack.
CVE-2007-0235.extra: By tricking a victim into executing an application that uses the libgtop library (e.g. libgtop_daemon or gnome-system-monitor), a local attacker could specify a specially crafted filename to be used by libgtop causing a buffer overflow and possibly execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-0243.title: AMD64 x86 emulation Sun's J2SE Development Kit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200702-08
CVE-2007-0243.subTitle: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities have been identified in Sun Java Development Kit (JDK) and Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE).
CVE-2007-0243.background: The Sun Java Development Kit (JDK) and the Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) provide the Sun Java platform. The x86 emulation Sun's J2SE Development Kit for AMD64 contains a vulnerable version of Sun's JDK.
CVE-2007-0243.body: Chris Evans has discovered multiple buffer overflows in Sun JDK and Sun JRE possibly related to various AWT or font layout functions. Tom Hawtin has discovered an unspecified vulnerability in Sun JDK and Sun JRE relating to unintended applet data access. He has also discovered multiple other unspecified vulnerabilities in Sun JDK and Sun JRE allowing unintended Java applet or application resource acquisition. Additionally, a memory corruption error has been found in the handling of GIF images with zero width field blocks.
CVE-2007-0243.extra: An attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted Java applet or application that could read, write, or execute local files with the privileges of the user running the JVM, access data maintained in other Java applets, or escalate the privileges of the currently running Java applet or application allowing for unauthorized access to system resources.

CVE-2007-0450.title: Tomcat: Information disclosure — GLSA 200705-03
CVE-2007-0450.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in Tomcat that allows for the disclosure of sensitive information.
CVE-2007-0450.background: Tomcat is the Apache Jakarta Project's official implementation of Java Servlets and Java Server Pages.
CVE-2007-0450.body: Tomcat allows special characters like slash, backslash or URL-encoded backslash as a separator, while Apache does not.
CVE-2007-0450.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted URL to the vulnerable Tomcat server, possibly resulting in a directory traversal and read access to arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running Tomcat. Note that this vulnerability can only be exploited when using apache proxy modules like mod_proxy, mod_rewrite or mod_jk.

CVE-2007-0451.title: SpamAssassin: Long URI Denial of service — GLSA 200703-02
CVE-2007-0451.subTitle: SpamAssassin is vulnerable to a Denial of Service attack.
CVE-2007-0451.background: SpamAssassin is an extensible email filter used to identify junk email.
CVE-2007-0451.body: SpamAssassin does not correctly handle very long URIs when scanning emails.
CVE-2007-0451.extra: An attacker could cause SpamAssassin to consume large amounts of CPU and memory resources by sending one or more emails containing very long URIs.

CVE-2007-0460.title: ulogd: Remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200703-17
CVE-2007-0460.subTitle: ulogd contains a possible buffer overflow potentially allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-0460.background: ulogd is a userspace daemon for netfilter related logging.
CVE-2007-0460.body: SUSE reported unspecified buffer overflows in ulogd involving the calculation of string lengths.
CVE-2007-0460.extra: A remote attacker could trigger a possible buffer overflow through unspecified vectors, potentially leading to the remote execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the ulogd daemon, or more probably leading to the crash of the daemon.

CVE-2007-0776.title: Mozilla Firefox: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-04
CVE-2007-0776.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-0776.background: Mozilla Firefox is a popular open-source web browser from the Mozilla Project.
CVE-2007-0776.body: Tom Ferris reported a heap-based buffer overflow involving wide SVG stroke widths that affects Mozilla Firefox 2 only. Various researchers reported some errors in the JavaScript engine potentially leading to memory corruption. Mozilla Firefox also contains minor vulnerabilities involving cache collision and unsafe pop-up restrictions, filtering or CSS rendering under certain conditions.
CVE-2007-0776.extra: An attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page that will trigger one of the vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code. It is also possible for an attacker to spoof the address bar, steal information through cache collision, bypass the local files protection mechanism with pop-ups, or perform cross-site scripting attacks, leading to the exposure of sensitive information, like user credentials.

CVE-2007-0776.title: Mozilla Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-18
CVE-2007-0776.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-0776.background: Mozilla Thunderbird is a popular open-source email client from the Mozilla Project.

CVE-2007-0898.title: ClamAV: Denial of service — GLSA 200703-03
CVE-2007-0898.subTitle: ClamAV contains two vulnerabilities allowing a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-0898.background: ClamAV is a GPL virus scanner.
CVE-2007-0898.body: An anonymous researcher discovered a file descriptor leak error in the processing of CAB archives and a lack of validation of the "id" parameter string used to create local files when parsing MIME headers.
CVE-2007-0898.extra: A remote attacker can send several crafted CAB archives with a zero-length record header that will fill the available file descriptors until no other is available, which will prevent ClamAV from scanning most archives. An attacker can also send an email with specially crafted MIME headers to overwrite local files with the permissions of the user running ClamAV, such as the virus database file, which could prevent ClamAV from detecting any virus.

CVE-2007-0906.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-21
CVE-2007-0906.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including a heap buffer overflow, potentially leading to the remote execution of arbitrary code under certain conditions.
CVE-2007-0906.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2007-0906.body: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP by the Hardened-PHP Project and other researchers. These vulnerabilities include a heap-based buffer overflow in htmlentities() and htmlspecialchars() if called with UTF-8 parameters, and an off-by-one error in str_ireplace(). Other vulnerabilities were also found in the PHP4 branch, including possible overflows, stack corruptions and a format string vulnerability in the *print() functions on 64 bit systems.
CVE-2007-0906.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2007-0908.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-21
CVE-2007-0908.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including a heap buffer overflow, potentially leading to the remote execution of arbitrary code under certain conditions.
CVE-2007-0908.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.

CVE-2007-0957.title: MIT Kerberos 5: Arbitrary remote code execution — GLSA 200704-02
CVE-2007-0957.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in MIT Kerberos 5 could potentially result in unauthenticated remote root code execution.
CVE-2007-0957.background: MIT Kerberos 5 is a suite of applications that implement the Kerberos network protocol.
CVE-2007-0957.body: The Kerberos telnet daemon fails to properly handle usernames allowing unauthorized access to any account (CVE-2007-0956). The Kerberos administration daemon, the KDC and possibly other applications using the MIT Kerberos libraries are vulnerable to the following issues. The krb5_klog_syslog function from the kadm5 library fails to properly validate input leading to a stack overflow (CVE-2007-0957). The GSS-API library is vulnerable to a double-free attack (CVE-2007-1216).
CVE-2007-0957.extra: By exploiting the telnet vulnerability a remote attacker may obtain access with root privileges. The remaining vulnerabilities may allow an authenticated remote attacker to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

CVE-2007-1001.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-19
CVE-2007-1001.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could under certain conditions lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1001.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2007-1001.body: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, most of them during the Month Of PHP Bugs (MOPB) by Stefan Esser. The most severe of these vulnerabilities are integer overflows in wbmp.c from the GD library (CVE-2007-1001) and in the substr_compare() PHP 5 function (CVE-2007-1375). Ilia Alshanetsky also reported a buffer overflow in the make_http_soap_request() and in the user_filter_factory_create() functions (CVE-2007-2510, CVE-2007-2511), and Stanislav Malyshev discovered another buffer overflow in the bundled XMLRPC library (CVE-2007-1864). Additionally, the session_regenerate_id() and the array_user_key_compare() functions contain a double-free vulnerability (CVE-2007-1484, CVE-2007-1521). Finally, there exist implementation errors in the Zend engine, in the mb_parse_str(), the unserialize() and the mail() functions and other elements.
CVE-2007-1001.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2007-1217.title: capi4k-utils: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200704-23
CVE-2007-1217.subTitle: capi4k-utils is vulnerable to a buffer overflow in the bufprint() function.
CVE-2007-1217.background: capi4k-utils is a set of utilities for accessing COMMON-ISDN-API software interfaces for ISDN devices.
CVE-2007-1217.body: The bufprint() function in capi4k-utils fails to properly check boundaries of data coming from CAPI packets.
CVE-2007-1217.extra: A local attacker could possibly escalate privileges or cause a Denial of Service by sending a crafted CAPI packet.

CVE-2007-1246.title: xine-lib: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 200704-09
CVE-2007-1246.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to a heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-1246.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player.
CVE-2007-1246.body: xine-lib does not check boundaries on data being read into buffers from DMO video files in code that is shared with MPlayer (DMO_VideoDecoder.c).
CVE-2007-1246.extra: An attacker could entice a user to play a specially crafted DMO video file with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2007-1246.title: MPlayer: Two buffer overflows — GLSA 200705-21
CVE-2007-1246.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in MPlayer, each one could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1246.background: MPlayer is a media player incuding support for a wide range of audio and video formats.
CVE-2007-1246.body: A buffer overflow has been reported in the DMO_VideoDecoder_Open() function in file loader/dmo/DMO_VideoDecoder.c. Another buffer overflow has been reported in the DS_VideoDecoder_Open() function in file loader/dshow/DS_VideoDecoder.c.
CVE-2007-1246.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted video file, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running MPlayer.

CVE-2007-1253.title: Blender: User-assisted remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200704-19
CVE-2007-1253.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in Blender allowing for user-assisted arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2007-1253.background: Blender is a 3D creation, animation and publishing program.
CVE-2007-1253.body: Stefan Cornelius of Secunia Research discovered an insecure use of the "eval()" function in kmz_ImportWithMesh.py.
CVE-2007-1253.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted Blender file (.kmz or .kml), resulting in the execution of arbitrary Python code with the privileges of the user running Blender.

CVE-2007-1285.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-19
CVE-2007-1285.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could under certain conditions lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

Finally, there exist implementation errors in the Zend engine, in the mb_parse_str(), the unserialize() and the mail() functions and other elements.
CVE-2007-1285.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2007-1327.title: SILC Server: Denial of service — GLSA 200703-12
CVE-2007-1327.subTitle: SILC Server is affected by a Denial of Service vulnerability.
CVE-2007-1327.background: SILC Server is a server for the Secure Internet Live Conferencing (SILC) protocol.
CVE-2007-1327.body: Frank Benkstein discovered a possible NULL pointer dereference in apps/silcd/command.c if a new channel is created without specifying a valid hmac or cipher algorithm name.
CVE-2007-1327.extra: A remote attacker could cause the server to crash, resulting in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-1349.title: Apache mod_perl: Denial of service — GLSA 200705-04
CVE-2007-1349.subTitle: The mod_perl Apache module is vulnerable to a Denial of Service when processing regular expressions.
CVE-2007-1349.background: Mod_perl is an Apache module that embeds the Perl interpreter within the server, allowing Perl-based web-applications to be created.
CVE-2007-1349.body: Alex Solvey discovered that the "path_info" variable used in file RegistryCooker.pm (mod_perl 2.x) or file PerlRun.pm (mod_perl 1.x), is not properly escaped before being processed.
CVE-2007-1349.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted URL to the vulnerable server, possibly resulting in a massive resource consumption.

CVE-2007-1351.title: FreeType: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200705-02
CVE-2007-1351.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in FreeType allowing for user-assisted remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1351.background: FreeType is a True Type Font rendering library.
CVE-2007-1351.body: Greg MacManus of iDefense Labs has discovered an integer overflow in the function bdfReadCharacters() when parsing BDF fonts.
CVE-2007-1351.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to use a specially crafted BDF font, possibly resulting in a heap-based buffer overflow and the remote execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-1351.title: LibXfont, TightVNC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-10
CVE-2007-1351.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in libXfont and TightVNC, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2007-1351.background: LibXfont is the X.Org font library. TightVNC is a VNC client/server for X displays.
CVE-2007-1351.body: The libXfont code is prone to several integer overflows, in functions ProcXCMiscGetXIDList(), bdfReadCharacters() and FontFileInitTable(). TightVNC contains a local copy of this code and is also affected.
CVE-2007-1351.extra: A local attacker could use a specially crafted BDF Font to gain root privileges on the vulnerable host.

CVE-2007-1362.title: Mozilla products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-06
CVE-2007-1362.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, SeaMonkey and XULRunner, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-1362.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser from the Mozilla Project, and Mozilla Thunderbird an email client. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the 'Mozilla Application Suite'. XULRunner is a Mozilla runtime package that can be used to bootstrap XUL+XPCOM applications like Firefox and Thunderbird.
CVE-2007-1362.body: Mozilla developers fixed several bugs involving memory corruption through various vectors (CVE-2007-2867, CVE-2007-2868). Additionally, several errors leading to crash, memory exhaustion or CPU consumption were fixed (CVE-2007-1362, CVE-2007-2869). Finally, errors related to the APOP protocol (CVE-2007-1558), XSS prevention (CVE-2007-2870) and spoofing prevention (CVE-2007-2871) were fixed.
CVE-2007-1362.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page that will trigger one of the vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service. It is also possible for an attacker to spoof the address bar or other browser elements, obtain sensitive APOP information, or perform cross-site scripting attacks, leading to the exposure of sensitive information, like user credentials.

CVE-2007-1383.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200703-21
CVE-2007-1383.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including a heap buffer overflow, potentially leading to the remote execution of arbitrary code under certain conditions.
CVE-2007-1383.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2007-1383.body: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP by the Hardened-PHP Project and other researchers. These vulnerabilities include a heap-based buffer overflow in htmlentities() and htmlspecialchars() if called with UTF-8 parameters, and an off-by-one error in str_ireplace(). Other vulnerabilities were also found in the PHP4 branch, including possible overflows, stack corruptions and a format string vulnerability in the *print() functions on 64 bit systems.
CVE-2007-1383.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2007-1466.title: libwpd: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200704-07
CVE-2007-1466.subTitle: libwpd is vulnerable to several heap overflows and an integer overflow.
CVE-2007-1466.background: libwpd is a library used to convert Wordperfect documents into other formats.
CVE-2007-1466.body: libwpd contains heap-based overflows in two functions that convert WordPerfect document tables. In addition, it contains an integer overflow in a text-conversion function.
CVE-2007-1466.extra: An attacker could entice a user to convert a specially crafted WordPerfect file, resulting in a crash or possibly the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running libwpd.

CVE-2007-1536.title: file: Integer underflow — GLSA 200703-26
CVE-2007-1536.subTitle: A buffer underflow vulnerability has been reported in file allowing for the user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1536.background: file is a utility that guesses a file format by scanning binary data for patterns.
CVE-2007-1536.body: Jean-Sebastien Guay-Leroux reported an integer underflow in file_printf function.
CVE-2007-1536.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run the "file" program on a specially crafted file that would trigger a heap-based buffer overflow possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running "file". Note that this vulnerability could be also triggered through an automatic file scanner like amavisd-new.

CVE-2007-1536.title: The Sleuth Kit: Integer underflow — GLSA 200710-19
CVE-2007-1536.subTitle: An integer underflow vulnerability has been reported in The Sleuth Kit allowing for the user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1536.background: The Sleuth Kit is a collection of file system and media management forensic analysis tools.
CVE-2007-1536.body: Jean-Sebastien Guay-Leroux reported an integer underflow in the file_printf() function of the "file" utility which is bundled with The Sleuth Kit (CVE-2007-1536, GLSA 200703-26). Note that Gentoo is not affected by the improper fix for this vulnerability (identified as CVE-2007-2799, see GLSA 200705-25) since version 4.20 of "file" was never shipped with The Sleuth Kit ebuilds.
CVE-2007-1536.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run The Sleuth Kit on a file system containing a specially crafted file that would trigger a heap-based buffer overflow possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the rights of the user running The Sleuth Kit.

CVE-2007-1576.title: PHProjekt: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-07
CVE-2007-1576.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in PHProjekt, allowing for the execution of arbitrary PHP and SQL code, and cross-site scripting attacks.
CVE-2007-1576.background: PHProjekt is a project management and coordination tool written in PHP.
CVE-2007-1576.body: Alexios Fakos from n.runs AG has discovered multiple vulnerabilities in PHProjekt, including the execution of arbitrary SQL commands using unknown vectors (CVE-2007-1575), the execution of arbitrary PHP code using an unrestricted file upload (CVE-2007-1639), cross-site request forgeries using different modules (CVE-2007-1638), and a cross-site scripting attack using unkown vectors (CVE-2007-1576).
CVE-2007-1576.extra: An authenticated user could elevate their privileges by exploiting the vulnerabilities described above. Note that the magic_quotes_gpc PHP configuration setting must be set to "off" to exploit these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2007-1659.title: PCRE: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-30
CVE-2007-1659.subTitle: PCRE is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflow and memory corruption vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1659.background: PCRE is a library providing functions for Perl-compatible regular expressions.
CVE-2007-1659.body: Tavis Ormandy (Google Security) discovered multiple vulnerabilities in PCRE. He reported an error when processing "\Q\E" sequences with unmatched "\E" codes that can lead to the compiled bytecode being corrupted (CVE-2007-1659). PCRE does not properly calculate sizes for unspecified "multiple forms of character class", which triggers a buffer overflow (CVE-2007-1660). Further improper calculations of memory boundaries were reported when matching certain input bytes against regex patterns in non UTF-8 mode (CVE-2007-1661) and when searching for unmatched brackets or parentheses (CVE-2007-1662). Multiple integer overflows when processing escape sequences may lead to invalid memory read operations or potentially cause heap-based buffer overflows (CVE-2007-4766). PCRE does not properly handle "\P" and "\P{x}" sequences which can lead to heap-based buffer overflows or trigger the execution of infinite loops (CVE-2007-4767), PCRE is also prone to an error when optimizing character classes containing a singleton UTF-8 sequence which might lead to a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-4768).
CVE-2007-1659.extra: Chris Evans also reported multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities in PCRE when processing a large number of named subpatterns ("name_count") or long subpattern names ("max_name_size") (CVE-2006-7227), and via large "min", "max", or "duplength" values (CVE-2006-7228) both possibly leading to buffer overflows. Another vulnerability was reported when compiling patterns where the "-x" or "-i" UTF-8 options change within the pattern, which might lead to improper memory calculations (CVE-2006-7230).

CVE-2007-1659.title: R: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-02
CVE-2007-1659.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in R could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1659.background: R is a GPL licensed implementation of S, a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. PCRE is a library providing functions for Perl-compatible regular expressions.
CVE-2007-1659.body: R includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1659.extra: An attacker could entice a user to process specially crafted regular expressions with R, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1659.title: Kazehakase: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-18
CVE-2007-1659.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Kazehakase could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1659.background: Kazehakase is a web browser based on the Gecko engine.
CVE-2007-1659.body: Kazehakase includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1659.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted input (e.g bookmarks) with Kazehakase, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1659.title: GOffice: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-19
CVE-2007-1659.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in GOffice could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1659.background: GOffice is a library of document-centric objects and utilities based on GTK.
CVE-2007-1659.body: GOffice includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1659.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted documents with GOffice, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1659.title: Chicken: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-11
CVE-2007-1659.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Chicken could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1659.background: Chicken is a Scheme interpreter and native Scheme to C compiler.
CVE-2007-1659.body: Chicken includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruption vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1659.extra: An attacker could entice a user to process specially crafted regular expressions with Chicken, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1660.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Kazehakase could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1660.background: Kazehakase is a web browser based on the Gecko engine.
CVE-2007-1660.body: Kazehakase includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1660.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted input (e.g bookmarks) with Kazehakase, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1660.title: GOffice: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-19
CVE-2007-1660.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in GOffice could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1660.background: GOffice is a library of document-centric objects and utilities based on GTK.
CVE-2007-1660.body: GOffice includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1660.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted documents with GOffice, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1660.title: Chicken: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-11
CVE-2007-1660.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Chicken could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1660.background: Chicken is a Scheme interpreter and native Scheme to C compiler.
CVE-2007-1660.body: Chicken includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruption vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-1660.extra: An attacker could entice a user to process specially crafted regular expressions with Chicken, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-1667.title: X.Org X11 library: Multiple integer overflows — GLSA 200705-06
CVE-2007-1667.subTitle: The X.Org X11 library contains multiple integer overflows, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1667.background: X.Org is an implementation of the X Window System. The X.Org X11 library provides the X11 protocol library files.
CVE-2007-1667.body: Multiple integer overflows have been reported in the XGetPixel() function of the X.Org X11 library.
CVE-2007-1667.extra: By enticing a user to open a specially crafted image, an attacker could cause a Denial of Service or an integer overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.

CVE-2007-1797.title: ImageMagick: Multiple buffer overflows — GLSA 200705-13
CVE-2007-1797.subTitle: Multiple integer overflows have been discovered in ImageMagick allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1797.background: ImageMagick is a collection of tools allowing various manipulations on image files.
CVE-2007-1797.body: iDefense Labs has discovered multiple integer overflows in ImageMagick in the functions ReadDCMImage() and ReadXWDImage(), that are used to process DCM and XWD files.
CVE-2007-1797.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted XWD or DCM file, resulting in heap-based buffer overflows and possibly the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ImageMagick. Note that this user may be httpd or any other account used by applications relying on the ImageMagick tools to automatically process images.

CVE-2007-1859.title: XScreenSaver: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200705-14
CVE-2007-1859.subTitle: XScreenSaver allows local users to bypass authentication under certain configurations.
CVE-2007-1859.background: XScreenSaver is a widely used screen saver collection shipped on systems running the X11 Window System.
CVE-2007-1859.body: XScreenSaver incorrectly handles the results of the getpwuid() function in drivers/lock.c when using directory servers during a network outage.
CVE-2007-1859.extra: A local user can crash XScreenSaver by preventing network connectivity if the system uses a remote directory service for credentials such as NIS or LDAP, which will unlock the screen.

CVE-2007-1860.title: Apache mod_jk: Directory traversal — GLSA 200708-15
CVE-2007-1860.subTitle: A directory traversal vulnerability has been discovered in Apache mod_jk.
CVE-2007-1860.background: Apache mod_jk is a connector for the Tomcat web server.
CVE-2007-1860.body: Apache mod_jk decodes the URL within Apache before passing them to Tomcat, which decodes them a second time.
CVE-2007-1860.extra: A remote attacker could browse a specially crafted URL on an Apache server running mod_jk, possibly gaining access to restricted resources.

CVE-2007-1864.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-19
CVE-2007-1864.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could under certain conditions lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-1864.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2007-1864.body: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, most of them during the Month Of PHP Bugs (MOPB) by Stefan Esser. The most severe of these vulnerabilities are integer overflows in wbmp.c from the GD library (CVE-2007-1001) and in the substr_compare() PHP 5 function (CVE-2007-1375). Ilia Alshanetsky also reported a buffer overflow in the make_http_soap_request() and in the user_filter_factory_create() functions (CVE-2007-2510, CVE-2007-2511), and Stanislav Malyshev discovered another buffer overflow in the bundled XMLRPC library (CVE-2007-1864). Additionally, the session_regenerate_id() and the array_user_key_compare() functions contain a double-free vulnerability (CVE-2007-1484, CVE-2007-1521). Finally, there exist implementation errors in the Zend engine, in the mb_parse_str(), the unserialize() and the mail() functions and other elements.
CVE-2007-1864.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2007-1995.title: Quagga: Denial of service — GLSA 200705-05
CVE-2007-1995.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in Quagga allowing for a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-1995.background: Quagga is a free routing daemon, supporting RIP, OSPF and BGP protocols.
CVE-2007-1995.body: The Quagga development team reported a vulnerability in the BGP routing deamon when processing NLRI attributes inside UPDATE messages.
CVE-2007-1995.extra: A malicious peer inside a BGP area could send a specially crafted packet to a Quagga instance, possibly resulting in a crash of the Quagga daemon.

CVE-2007-2138.title: PostgreSQL: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200705-12
CVE-2007-2138.subTitle: PostgreSQL contains a vulnerability that could result in SQL privilege escalation.
CVE-2007-2138.background: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.
CVE-2007-2138.body: An error involving insecure search_path settings in the SECURITY DEFINER functions has been reported in PostgreSQL.
CVE-2007-2138.extra: If allowed to call a SECURITY DEFINER function, an attacker could gain the SQL privileges of the owner of the called function.

CVE-2007-2356.title: GIMP: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200705-08
CVE-2007-2356.subTitle: GIMP is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-2356.background: GIMP is the GNU Image Manipulation Program.
CVE-2007-2356.body: Marsu discovered that the "set_color_table()" function in the SUNRAS plugin is vulnerable to a stack-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-2356.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted .RAS file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running GIMP.

CVE-2007-2435.title: emul-linux-x86-java: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-08
CVE-2007-2435.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in emul-linux-x86-java, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-2435.background: emul-linux-x86-java is the 32 bit version of the Sun's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-2435.body: Chris Evans of the Google Security Team has discovered an integer overflow in the ICC parser, and another vulnerability in the BMP parser. An unspecified vulnerability involving an "incorrect use of system classes" was reported by the Fujitsu security team.
CVE-2007-2435.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Emul-linux-x86-java. They also could entice a user to open a specially crafted BMP image, resulting in a Denial of Service. Note that these vulnerabilities may also be triggered by a tool processing image files automatically.

CVE-2007-2435.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-2435.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-2435.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-2435.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-2435.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-2446.title: Samba: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-15
CVE-2007-2446.subTitle: Samba contains multiple vulnerabilities potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2007-2446.background: Samba is a suite of SMB and CIFS client/server programs for UNIX.
CVE-2007-2446.body: Samba contains a logical error in the smbd daemon when translating local SID to user names (CVE-2007-2444). Furthermore, Samba contains several bugs when parsing NDR encoded RPC parameters (CVE-2007-2446). Lastly, Samba fails to properly sanitize remote procedure input provided via Microsoft Remote Procedure Calls (CVE-2007-2447).
CVE-2007-2446.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to gain root privileges via various vectors.

CVE-2007-2509.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-19
CVE-2007-2509.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could under certain conditions lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-2509.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2007-2509.body: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, most of them during the Month Of PHP Bugs (MOPB) by Stefan Esser. The most severe of these vulnerabilities are integer overflows in wbmp.c from the GD library (CVE-2007-1001) and in the substr_compare() PHP 5 function (CVE-2007-1375). Ilia Alshanetsky also reported a buffer overflow in the make_http_soap_request() and in the user_filter_factory_create() functions (CVE-2007-2510, CVE-2007-2511), and Stanislav Malyshev discovered another buffer overflow in the bundled XMLRPC library (CVE-2007-1864). Additionally, the session_regenerate_id() and the array_user_key_compare() functions contain a double-free vulnerability (CVE-2007-1484, CVE-2007-1521). Finally, there exist implementation errors in the Zend engine, in the mb_parse_str(), the unserialize() and the mail() functions and other elements.
CVE-2007-2509.extra: Remote attackers might be able to exploit these issues in PHP applications making use of the affected functions, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code, Denial of Service, execution of scripted contents in the context of the affected site, security bypass or information leak.

CVE-2007-2510.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-19
CVE-2007-2510.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could under certain conditions lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-2510.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2007-2510.body: Several vulnerabilities were found in PHP, most of them during the Month Of PHP Bugs (MOPB) by Stefan Esser. Ilia Alshanetsky also reported a buffer overflow in the make_http_soap_request() and in the user_filter_factory_create() functions (CVE-2007-2510, CVE-2007-2511), and Stanislav Malyshev discovered another buffer overflow in the bundled XMLRPC library (CVE-2007-1864). Additionally, the session_regenerate_id() and the array_user_key_compare() functions contain a double-free vulnerability (CVE-2007-1484, CVE-2007-1521). Finally, there exist implementation errors in the Zend engine, in the mb_parse_str(), the unserialize() and the mail() functions and other elements.

CVE-2007-2583.title: MySQL: Two Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200705-11
CVE-2007-2583.subTitle: Two Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been discovered in MySQL.
CVE-2007-2583.background: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server.
CVE-2007-2583.body: mu-b discovered a NULL pointer dereference in item_cmpfunc.cc when processing certain types of SQL requests. Sec Consult also discovered another NULL pointer dereference when sorting certain types of queries on the database metadata.
CVE-2007-2583.extra: In both cases, a remote attacker could send a specially crafted SQL request to the server, possibly resulting in a server crash. Note that the attacker needs the ability to execute SELECT queries.

CVE-2007-2788.title: emul-linux-x86-java: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-08
CVE-2007-2788.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in emul-linux-x86-java, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-2788.background: emul-linux-x86-java is the 32 bit version of the Sun's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-2788.body: Chris Evans of the Google Security Team has discovered an integer overflow in the ICC parser, and another vulnerability in the BMP parser. An unspecified vulnerability involving an "incorrect use of system classes" was reported by the Fujitsu security team.
CVE-2007-2788.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Emul-linux-x86-java. They also could entice a user to open a specially crafted BMP image, resulting in a Denial of Service. Note that these vulnerabilities may also be triggered by a tool processing image files automatically.

CVE-2007-2788.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-2788.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-2788.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-2788.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-2788.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-2789.title: emul-linux-x86-java: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-08
CVE-2007-2789.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in emul-linux-x86-java, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-2789.background: emul-linux-x86-java is the 32 bit version of the Sun's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-2789.body: Chris Evans of the Google Security Team has discovered an integer overflow in the ICC parser, and another vulnerability in the BMP parser. An unspecified vulnerability involving an "incorrect use of system classes" was reported by the Fujitsu security team.
CVE-2007-2789.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Emul-linux-x86-java. They also could entice a user to open a specially crafted BMP image, resulting in a Denial of Service. Note that these vulnerabilities may also be triggered by a tool processing image files automatically.

CVE-2007-2789.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-2789.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-2789.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-2789.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-2789.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-2798.title: MIT Kerberos 5: Arbitrary remote code execution — GLSA 200707-11
CVE-2007-2798.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in MIT Kerberos 5 could potentially result in remote code execution with root privileges by unauthenticated users.
CVE-2007-2798.background: MIT Kerberos 5 is a suite of applications that implement the Kerberos network protocol.
CVE-2007-2798.body: kadmind is affected by multiple vulnerabilities in the RPC library shipped with MIT Kerberos 5. It fails to properly handle zero-length RPC credentials (CVE-2007-2442) and the RPC library can write past the end of the stack buffer (CVE-2007-2443). Furthermore kadmind fails to do proper bounds checking (CVE-2007-2798).
CVE-2007-2798.extra: A remote unauthenticated attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.

CVE-2007-2831.title: MadWifi: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-04
CVE-2007-2831.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in MadWifi, possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-2831.background: The MadWifi driver provides support for Atheros based IEEE 802.11 Wireless Lan cards.
CVE-2007-2831.body: Md Sohail Ahmad from AirTight Networks has discovered a divison by zero in the ath_beacon_config() function (CVE-2007-2830). The vendor has corrected an input validation error in the ieee80211_ioctl_getwmmparams() and ieee80211_ioctl_getwmmparams() functions(CVE-207-2831), and an input sanitization error when parsing nested 802.3 Ethernet frame lengths (CVE-2007-2829).
CVE-2007-2831.extra: An attacker could send specially crafted packets to a vulnerable host to exploit one of these vulnerabilities, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-2834.title: OpenOffice.org: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-24
CVE-2007-2834.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in OpenOffice.org, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-2834.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2007-2834.body: iDefense Labs reported that the TIFF parsing code uses untrusted values to calculate buffer sizes, which can lead to an integer overflow resulting in heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-2834.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted document, possibly leading to execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running OpenOffice.org.

CVE-2007-2867.title: Mozilla products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-06
CVE-2007-2867.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, SeaMonkey and XULRunner, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-2867.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser from the Mozilla Project, and Mozilla Thunderbird an email client. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the 'Mozilla Application Suite'. XULRunner is a Mozilla runtime package that can be used to bootstrap XUL+XPCOM applications like Firefox and Thunderbird.
CVE-2007-2867.body: Mozilla developers fixed several bugs involving memory corruption through various vectors (CVE-2007-2867, CVE-2007-2868). Additionally, several errors leading to crash, memory exhaustion or CPU consumption were fixed (CVE-2007-1362, CVE-2007-2869). Finally, errors related to the APOP protocol (CVE-2007-1558), XSS prevention (CVE-2007-2870) and spoofing prevention (CVE-2007-2871) were fixed.
CVE-2007-2867.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page that will trigger one of the vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service. It is also possible for an attacker to spoof the address bar or other browser elements, obtain sensitive APOP information, or perform cross-site scripting attacks, leading to the exposure of sensitive information, like user credentials.

CVE-2007-2868.title: Mozilla products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200706-06
CVE-2007-2868.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, SeaMonkey and XULRunner, some of which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-2868.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser from the Mozilla Project, and Mozilla Thunderbird an email client. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the 'Mozilla Application Suite'. XULRunner is a Mozilla runtime package that can be used to bootstrap XUL+XPCOM applications like Firefox and Thunderbird.
CVE-2007-2868.body: Mozilla developers fixed several bugs involving memory corruption through various vectors (CVE-2007-2867, CVE-2007-2868). Additionally, several errors leading to crash, memory exhaustion or CPU consumption were fixed (CVE-2007-1362, CVE-2007-2869). Finally, errors related to the APOP protocol (CVE-2007-1558), XSS prevention (CVE-2007-2870) and spoofing prevention (CVE-2007-2871) were fixed.
CVE-2007-2868.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view a specially crafted web page that will trigger one of the vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service. It is also possible for an attacker to spoof the address bar or other browser elements, obtain sensitive APOP information, or perform cross-site scripting attacks, leading to the exposure of sensitive information, like user credentials.

CVE-2007-2893.title: Bochs: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-21
CVE-2007-2893.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Bochs, possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-2893.background: Bochs is a IA-32 (x86) PC emulator written in C++.
CVE-2007-2893.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered a heap-based overflow vulnerability in the NE2000 driver (CVE-2007-2893). He also discovered a divide-by-zero error in the emulated floppy disk controller (CVE-2007-2894).
CVE-2007-2893.extra: A local attacker in the guest operating system could exploit these issues to execute code outside of the virtual machine, or cause Bochs to crash.

CVE-2007-3106.title: libvorbis: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-03
CVE-2007-3106.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability and several memory corruptions have been discovered in libvorbis.
CVE-2007-3106.background: libvorbis is the reference implementation of the Xiph.org Ogg Vorbis audio file format. It is used by many applications for playback of Ogg Vorbis files.
CVE-2007-3106.body: David Thiel of iSEC Partners discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in the _01inverse() function in res0.c and a boundary checking error in the vorbis_info_clear() function in info.c (CVE-2007-3106 and CVE-2007-4029). libvorbis is also prone to several Denial of Service vulnerabilities in form of infinite loops and invalid memory access with unknown impact (CVE-2007-4065 and CVE-2007-4066).
CVE-2007-3106.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to open a specially crafted Ogg Vorbis file or network stream with an application using libvorbis. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user playing the file or a Denial of Service by a crash or CPU consumption.

CVE-2007-3156.title: Webmin, Usermin: Cross-site scripting vulnerabilities — GLSA 200707-05
CVE-2007-3156.subTitle: Webmin and Usermin are vulnerable to cross-site scripting vulnerabilities (XSS).
CVE-2007-3156.background: Webmin is a web-based administrative interface for Unix-like systems. Usermin is a simplified version of Webmin designed for use by normal users rather than system administrators.
CVE-2007-3156.body: The pam_login.cgi file does not properly sanitize user input before sending it back as output to the user.
CVE-2007-3156.extra: An unauthenticated attacker could entice a user to browse a specially crafted URL, allowing for the execution of script code in the context of the user's browser and for the theft of browser credentials. This may permit the attacker to login to Webmin or Usermin with the user's permissions.

CVE-2007-3227.title: Ruby on Rails: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-17
CVE-2007-3227.subTitle: Several vulnerabilities were found in Ruby on Rails allowing for file disclosure and theft of user credentials.
CVE-2007-3227.background: Ruby on Rails is a free web framework used to develop database-driven web applications.
CVE-2007-3227.body: candlerb found that ActiveResource, when processing responses using the Hash.from_xml() function, does not properly sanitize filenames (CVE-2007-5380). The session management functionality allowed the "session_id" to be set in the URL (CVE-2007-5380). BCC discovered that the to_json() function does not properly sanitize input before returning it to the user (CVE-2007-3227).
CVE-2007-3227.extra: Unauthenticated remote attackers could exploit these vulnerabilities to determine the existence of files or to read the contents of arbitrary XML files; conduct session fixation attacks and gain unauthorized access; and to execute arbitrary HTML and script code in a user's browser session in context of an affected site by enticing a user to browse a specially crafted URL.

CVE-2007-3278.title: PostgreSQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-15
CVE-2007-3278.subTitle: PostgreSQL contains multiple vulnerabilities that could result in privilege escalation or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-3278.background: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.
CVE-2007-3278.body: If using the "expression indexes" feature, PostgreSQL executes index functions as the superuser during VACUUM and ANALYZE instead of the table owner, and allows SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION in the index functions (CVE-2007-6600). Additionally, several errors involving regular expressions were found (CVE-2007-4769, CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067). Eventually, a privilege escalation vulnerability via unspecified vectors in the DBLink module was reported (CVE-2007-6601). This vulnerability is exploitable when local trust or ident authentication is used, and is due to an incomplete fix of CVE-2007-3278.
CVE-2007-3278.extra: A remote authenticated attacker could send specially crafted queries containing complex regular expressions to the server that could result in a Denial of Service by a server crash (CVE-2007-4769), an infinite loop (CVE-2007-4772) or a memory exhaustion (CVE-2007-6067). The two other vulnerabilities can be exploited to gain additional privileges.

CVE-2007-3381.title: GDM: Local Denial of service — GLSA 200709-11
CVE-2007-3381.subTitle: GDM can be crashed by a local user, preventing it from managing future displays.
CVE-2007-3381.background: GDM is the GNOME display manager.
CVE-2007-3381.body: The result of a g_strsplit() call is incorrectly parsed in the files daemon/gdm.c, daemon/gdmconfig.c, gui/gdmconfig.c and gui/gdmflexiserver.c, allowing for a null pointer dereference.
CVE-2007-3381.extra: A local user could send a crafted message to /tmp/.gdm_socket that would trigger the null pointer dereference and crash GDM, thus preventing it from managing future displays.

CVE-2007-3387.title: Poppler: Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities — GLSA 200709-12
CVE-2007-3387.subTitle: Poppler is vulnerable to an integer overflow and a stack overflow.
CVE-2007-3387.background: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf.
CVE-2007-3387.body: Poppler and Xpdf are vulnerable to an integer overflow in the StreamPredictor::StreamPredictor function, and a stack overflow in the StreamPredictor::getNextLine function. The original vulnerability was discovered by Maurycy Prodeus. Note: Gentoo's version of Xpdf is patched to use the Poppler library, so the update to Poppler will also fix Xpdf.
CVE-2007-3387.extra: By enticing a user to view a specially crafted program with a Poppler-based PDF viewer such as Gentoo's Xpdf, Epdfview, or Evince, a remote attacker could cause an overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-3387.title: PDFKit, ImageKits: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-20
CVE-2007-3387.subTitle: PDFKit and ImageKits are vulnerable to an integer overflow and a stack overflow allowing for the user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-3387.background: PDFKit is a framework for rendering of PDF content in GNUstep applications. ImageKits is a collection of frameworks to support imaging in GNUstep applications.
CVE-2007-3387.body: Maurycy Prodeus discovered an integer overflow vulnerability possibly leading to a stack-based buffer overflow in the XPDF code which PDFKit is based on. ImageKits also contains a copy of PDFKit.
CVE-2007-3387.extra: By enticing a user to view a specially crafted PDF file with a viewer based on ImageKits or PDFKit such as Gentoo's ViewPDF, a remote attacker could cause an overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-3387.title: teTeX: Multiple buffer overflows — GLSA 200709-17
CVE-2007-3387.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in teTeX, allowing for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-3387.background: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for editing documents.
CVE-2007-3387.body: Mark Richters discovered a buffer overflow in the open_sty() function in file mkind.c. Other vulnerabilities have also been discovered in the same file but might not be exploitable (CVE-2007-0650). Tetex also includes vulnerable code from GD library (GLSA 200708-05), and from Xpdf (CVE-2007-3387).
CVE-2007-3387.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted PNG, GIF or PDF file, or to execute "makeindex" on an overly long filename. In both cases, this could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-3387.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-34
CVE-2007-3387.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-3387.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-3387.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-3387.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-3387.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-3387.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-3387.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-3387.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-3387.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.

CVE-2007-3389.title: Wireshark: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200708-12
CVE-2007-3389.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-3389.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2007-3389.body: Wireshark doesn't properly handle chunked encoding in HTTP responses (CVE-2007-3389), iSeries capture files (CVE-2007-3390), certain types of DCP ETSI packets (CVE-2007-3391), and SSL or MMS packets (CVE-2007-3392). An off-by-one error has been discovered in the DHCP/BOOTP dissector when handling DHCP-over-DOCSIS packets (CVE-2007-3393).
CVE-2007-3389.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted packets on a network being monitored with Wireshark, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Wireshark which might be the root user, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-3391.title: Wireshark: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200708-12
CVE-2007-3391.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-3391.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2007-3391.body: Wireshark doesn't properly handle chunked encoding in HTTP responses (CVE-2007-3389), iSeries capture files (CVE-2007-3390), certain types of DCP ETSI packets (CVE-2007-3391), and SSL or MMS packets (CVE-2007-3392). An off-by-one error has been discovered in the DHCP/BOOTP dissector when handling DHCP-over-DOCSIS packets (CVE-2007-3393).
CVE-2007-3391.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted packets on a network being monitored with Wireshark, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Wireshark which might be the root user, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-3410.title: RealPlayer: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200709-05
CVE-2007-3410.subTitle: RealPlayer is vulnerable to a buffer overflow allowing for execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-3410.background: RealPlayer is a multimedia player capable of handling multiple multimedia file formats.
CVE-2007-3410.body: A stack-based buffer overflow vulnerability has been reported in the SmilTimeValue::parseWallClockValue() function in smlprstime.cpp when handling HH:mm:ss.f type time formats.
CVE-2007-3410.extra: By enticing a user to open a specially crafted SMIL (Synchronized Multimedia Integration Language) file, an attacker could be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-3472.title: GD: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200708-05
CVE-2007-3472.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GD, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-3472.background: GD is a graphic library for fast image creation.
CVE-2007-3472.body: Xavier Roche discovered an infinite loop in the gdPngReadData() function when processing a truncated PNG file (CVE-2007-2756). An integer overflow has been discovered in the gdImageCreateTrueColor() function (CVE-2007-3472). An error has been discovered in the function gdImageCreateXbm() function (CVE-2007-3473). Unspecified vulnerabilities have been discovered in the GIF reader (CVE-2007-3474). An error has been discovered when processing a GIF image that has no global color map (CVE-2007-3475). An array index error has been discovered in the file gd_gif_in.c when processing images with an invalid color index (CVE-2007-3476). An error has been discovered in the imagearc() and imagefilledarc() functions when processing overly large angle values (CVE-2007-3477). A race condition has been discovered in the gdImageStringFTEx() function (CVE-2007-3478).
CVE-2007-3472.extra: A remote attacker could exploit one of these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running GD.

CVE-2007-3472.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-34
CVE-2007-3472.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-3472.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-3472.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-3472.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-3472.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-3472.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-3472.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-3472.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-3472.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.
