CVE-2007-3477.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-3477.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-3477.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-3477.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-3477.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-3477.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-3477.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-3477.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-3477.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.

CVE-2007-3508.title: GNU C Library: Integer overflow — GLSA 200707-04
CVE-2007-3508.subTitle: An integer overflow in the dynamic loader, ld.so, could result in the execution of arbitrary code with escalated privileges.
CVE-2007-3508.background: The GNU C library is the standard C library used by Gentoo Linux systems. It provides programs with basic facilities and interfaces to system calls. ld.so is the dynamic linker which prepares dynamically linked programs for execution by resolving runtime dependencies and related functions.
CVE-2007-3508.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Gentoo Linux Security Team discovered a flaw in the handling of the hardware capabilities mask by the dynamic loader. If a mask is specified with a high population count, an integer overflow could occur when allocating memory.
CVE-2007-3508.extra: As the hardware capabilities mask is honored by the dynamic loader during the execution of suid and sgid programs, in theory this vulnerability could result in the execution of arbitrary code with root privileges. This update is provided as a precaution against currently unknown attack vectors.

CVE-2007-3655.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-3655.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-3655.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-3655.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-3655.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-3780.title: MySQL: Denial of Service and information leakage — GLSA 200708-10
CVE-2007-3780.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability and a table structure information leakage vulnerability were found in MySQL.
CVE-2007-3780.background: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server.
CVE-2007-3780.body: Dormando reported a vulnerability within the handling of password packets in the connection protocol (CVE-2007-3780). Andrei Elkin also found that the "CREATE TABLE LIKE" command didn't require SELECT privileges on the source table (CVE-2007-3781).
CVE-2007-3780.extra: A remote unauthenticated attacker could use the first vulnerability to make the server crash. The second vulnerability can be used by authenticated users to obtain information on tables they are not normally able to access.

CVE-2007-3798.title: tcpdump: Integer overflow — GLSA 200707-14
CVE-2007-3798.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in tcpdump, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code, possibly with root privileges.
CVE-2007-3798.background: tcpdump is a tool for capturing and inspecting network traffic.
CVE-2007-3798.body: mu-b from Digital Labs discovered that the return value of a snprintf() call is not properly checked before being used. This could lead to an integer overflow.
CVE-2007-3798.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted BGP packets on a network being monitored with tcpdump, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running tcpdump, which is usually root.

CVE-2007-3929.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200708-17
CVE-2007-3929.subTitle: Opera contain several vulnerabilities, some of which may allow the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-3929.background: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.
CVE-2007-3929.body: An error known as "a virtual function call on an invalid pointer" has been discovered in the JavaScript engine (CVE-2007-4367). Furthermore, iDefense Labs reported that an already-freed pointer may be still used under unspecified circumstances in the BitTorrent support (CVE-2007-3929). At last, minor other errors have been discovered, relative to memory read protection (Opera Advisory 861) and URI displays (CVE-2007-3142, CVE-2007-3819).
CVE-2007-3929.extra: A remote attacker could trigger the BitTorrent vulnerability by enticing a user into starting a malicious BitTorrent download, and execute arbitrary code through unspecified vectors. Additionally, a specially crafted JavaScript may trigger the "virtual function" vulnerability. The JavaScript engine can also access previously freed but uncleaned memory. Finally, a user can be fooled with a too long HTTP server name that does not fit the dialog box, or a URI containing whitespaces.

CVE-2007-3962.title: gFTP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-01
CVE-2007-3962.subTitle: Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in fsplib code used in gFTP.
CVE-2007-3962.background: gFTP is an FTP client for the GNOME desktop environment.
CVE-2007-3962.body: Kalle Olavi Niemitalo discovered two boundary errors in fsplib code included in gFTP when processing overly long directory or file names.
CVE-2007-3962.extra: A remote attacker could trigger these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to download a file with a specially crafted directory or file name, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code (CVE-2007-3962) or a Denial of Service (CVE-2007-3961).

CVE-2007-3996.title: E2fsprogs: Multiple buffer overflows — GLSA 200712-13
CVE-2007-3996.subTitle: Multiple heap-based buffer overflows in E2fsprogs could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-3996.background: E2fsprogs provides utilities for use with the ext2 and ext3 file systems including the libext2fs library that allows user-level programs to manipulate an ext2 or ext3 file system.
CVE-2007-3996.body: Rafal Wojtczuk (McAfee AVERT Research) discovered multiple integer overflows in libext2fs, that are triggered when processing information from within the file system, resulting in heap-based buffer overflows.
CVE-2007-3996.extra: An attacker could entice a user to process a specially-crafted ext2 or ext3 file system image (with tools linking against libext2fs, e.g. fsck, forensic tools or Xen's pygrub), possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-3999.title: RPCSEC_GSS library: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-01
CVE-2007-3999.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in librpcsecgss.
CVE-2007-3999.background: librpcsecgss is an implementation of RPCSEC_GSS for secure RPC communications.
CVE-2007-3999.body: A stack based buffer overflow has been discovered in the svcauth_gss_validate() function in file lib/rpc/svc_auth_gss.c when processing an overly long string in a RPC message.
CVE-2007-3999.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted RPC request to an application relying on this library, e.g NFSv4 or Kerberos (GLSA-200709-01), resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-4033.title: T1Lib: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-12
CVE-2007-4033.subTitle: T1Lib is vulnerable to a buffer overflow allowing for the user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4033.background: T1Lib is a library for rasterizing bitmaps from Adobe Type 1 fonts.
CVE-2007-4033.body: Hamid Ebadi discovered a boundary error in the intT1_EnvGetCompletePath() function which can lead to a buffer overflow when processing an overly long filename.
CVE-2007-4033.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a font file with a specially crafted filename, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application using T1Lib.

CVE-2007-4033.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-34
CVE-2007-4033.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-4033.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-4033.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-4033.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-4033.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-4033.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-4033.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-4033.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-4033.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.

CVE-2007-4066.title: libvorbis: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-03
CVE-2007-4066.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability and several memory corruptions have been discovered in libvorbis.
CVE-2007-4066.background: libvorbis is the reference implementation of the Xiph.org Ogg Vorbis audio file format. It is used by many applications for playback of Ogg Vorbis files.
CVE-2007-4066.body: David Thiel of iSEC Partners discovered a heap-based buffer overflow in the _01inverse() function in res0.c and a boundary checking error in the vorbis_info_clear() function in info.c (CVE-2007-3106 and CVE-2007-4029). libvorbis is also prone to several Denial of Service vulnerabilities in form of infinite loops and invalid memory access with unknown impact (CVE-2007-4065 and CVE-2007-4066).
CVE-2007-4066.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to open a specially crafted Ogg Vorbis file or network stream with an application using libvorbis. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user playing the file or a Denial of Service by a crash or CPU consumption.

CVE-2007-4137.title: Qt: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-28
CVE-2007-4137.subTitle: An off-by-one vulnerability has been discovered in Qt, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4137.background: Qt is a cross-platform GUI framework, which is used e.g. by KDE.
CVE-2007-4137.body: Dirk Mueller from the KDE development team discovered a boundary error in file qutfcodec.cpp when processing Unicode strings.
CVE-2007-4137.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted Unicode string to a vulnerable Qt application, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Note that the boundary error is present but reported to be not exploitable in 4.x series.

CVE-2007-4137.title: AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-08
CVE-2007-4137.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library may lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code in Qt applications.
CVE-2007-4137.background: Qt is a cross-platform GUI framework, which is used e.g. by KDE. The AMD64 x86 emulation Qt library packages Qt libraries for 32bit x86 emulation on AMD64.
CVE-2007-4137.body: The Qt versions used by the AMD64 x86 emulation Qt libraries were vulnerable to several flaws (GLSA 200708-16, GLSA 200710-28)
CVE-2007-4137.extra: An attacker could trigger one of the vulnerabilities by causing a Qt application to parse specially crafted text or Unicode strings, which may lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-4337.title: Streamripper: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200709-03
CVE-2007-4337.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Streamripper, allowing for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4337.background: Streamripper is a tool for extracting and recording mp3 files from a Shoutcast stream.
CVE-2007-4337.body: Chris Rohlf discovered several boundary errors in the httplib_parse_sc_header() function when processing HTTP headers.
CVE-2007-4337.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious streaming server, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Streamripper.

CVE-2007-4351.title: CUPS: Memory corruption — GLSA 200711-16
CVE-2007-4351.subTitle: CUPS contains a boundary checking error that might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4351.background: CUPS provides a portable printing layer for UNIX-based operating systems.
CVE-2007-4351.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) discovered an off-by-one error in the ippReadIO() function when handling Internet Printing Protocol (IPP) tags that might allow to overwrite one byte on the stack.
CVE-2007-4351.extra: A local attacker could send a specially crafted IPP request containing "textWithLanguage" or "nameWithLanguage" tags, leading to a Denial of Service or the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the "lp" user. If CUPS is configured to allow network printing, this vulnerability might be remotely exploitable.

CVE-2007-4438.title: Ampache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-13
CVE-2007-4438.subTitle: An SQL injection vulnerability and a possible identity theft have been discovered in Ampache.
CVE-2007-4438.background: Ampache is a PHP-based tool for managing, updating and playing audio files via a web interface.
CVE-2007-4438.body: LT discovered that the "match" parameter in albums.php is not properly sanitized before being processed. The Ampache development team also reported an error when handling user sessions.
CVE-2007-4438.extra: A remote attacker could provide malicious input to the application, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary SQL code. He could also entice a user to open a specially crafted link to steal the user's session.

CVE-2007-4465.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-06
CVE-2007-4465.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.
CVE-2007-4465.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2007-4465.body: Multiple cross-site scripting vulnerabilities have been discovered in mod_status and mod_autoindex (CVE-2006-5752, CVE-2007-4465). An error has been discovered in the recall_headers() function in mod_mem_cache (CVE-2007-1862). The mod_cache module does not properly sanitize requests before processing them (CVE-2007-1863). The Prefork module does not properly check PID values before sending signals (CVE-2007-3304). The mod_proxy module does not correctly check headers before processing them (CVE-2007-3847).
CVE-2007-4465.extra: A remote attacker could exploit one of these vulnerabilities to inject arbitrary script or HTML content, obtain sensitive information or cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-4476.title: Cpio: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200711-18
CVE-2007-4476.subTitle: GNU cpio contains a buffer overflow vulnerability, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4476.background: GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive.
CVE-2007-4476.body: A buffer overflow vulnerability in the safer_name_suffix() function in GNU cpio has been discovered.
CVE-2007-4476.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted archive file resulting in a stack-based buffer overflow, possibly crashing the application. It is disputed whether the execution of arbitrary code is possible.

CVE-2007-4496.title: VMware Workstation and Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-23
CVE-2007-4496.subTitle: VMware guest operating systems might be able to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the host operating system through multiple flaws.
CVE-2007-4496.background: VMware Workstation is a virtual machine for developers and system administrators. VMware Player is a freeware virtualization software that can run guests produced by other VMware products.
CVE-2007-4496.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in several VMware products. Neel Mehta and Ryan Smith (IBM ISS X-Force) discovered that the DHCP server contains an integer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2007-0062), an integer underflow vulnerability (CVE-2007-0063) and another error when handling malformed packets (CVE-2007-0061), leading to stack-based buffer overflows or stack corruption. Rafal Wojtczvk (McAfee) discovered two unspecified errors that allow authenticated users with administrative or login privileges on a guest operating system to corrupt memory or cause a Denial of Service (CVE-2007-4496, CVE-2007-4497). Another unspecified vulnerability related to untrusted virtual machine images was discovered (CVE-2007-5617).
CVE-2007-4496.extra: VMware products also shipped code copies of software with several vulnerabilities: Samba (GLSA-200705-15), BIND (GLSA-200702-06), MIT Kerberos 5 (GLSA-200707-11), Vixie Cron (GLSA-200704-11), shadow (GLSA-200606-02), OpenLDAP (CVE-2006-4600), PAM (CVE-2004-0813, CVE-2007-1716), GCC (CVE-2006-3619) and GDB (CVE-2006-4146).

CVE-2007-4497.title: VMware Workstation and Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-23
CVE-2007-4497.subTitle: VMware guest operating systems might be able to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on the host operating system through multiple flaws.
CVE-2007-4497.background: VMware Workstation is a virtual machine for developers and system administrators. VMware Player is a freeware virtualization software that can run guests produced by other VMware products.
CVE-2007-4497.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in several VMware products. Neel Mehta and Ryan Smith (IBM ISS X-Force) discovered that the DHCP server contains an integer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2007-0062), an integer underflow vulnerability (CVE-2007-0063) and another error when handling malformed packets (CVE-2007-0061), leading to stack-based buffer overflows or stack corruption. Rafal Wojtczvk (McAfee) discovered two unspecified errors that allow authenticated users with administrative or login privileges on a guest operating system to corrupt memory or cause a Denial of Service (CVE-2007-4496, CVE-2007-4497). Another unspecified vulnerability related to untrusted virtual machine images was discovered (CVE-2007-5617).
CVE-2007-4497.extra: VMware products also shipped code copies of software with several vulnerabilities: Samba (GLSA-200705-15), BIND (GLSA-200702-06), MIT Kerberos 5 (GLSA-200707-11), Vixie Cron (GLSA-200704-11), shadow (GLSA-200606-02), OpenLDAP (CVE-2006-4600), PAM (CVE-2004-0813, CVE-2007-1716), GCC (CVE-2006-3619) and GDB (CVE-2006-4146).

CVE-2007-4539.title: Bugzilla: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200709-18
CVE-2007-4539.subTitle: Bugzilla contains several vulnerabilities, some of them possibly leading to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4539.background: Bugzilla is a web application designed to help with managing software development.
CVE-2007-4539.body: Masahiro Yamada found that from the 2.17.1 version, Bugzilla does not properly sanitize the content of the "buildid" parameter when filing bugs (CVE-2007-4543). The next two vulnerabilities only affect Bugzilla 2.23.3 or later, hence the stable Gentoo Portage tree does not contain these two vulnerabilities: Loic Minier reported that the "Email::Send::Sendmail()" function does not properly sanitise "from" email information before sending it to the "-f" parameter of /usr/sbin/sendmail (CVE-2007-4538), and Frederic Buclin discovered that the XML-RPC interface does not correctly check permissions in the time-tracking fields (CVE-2007-4539).
CVE-2007-4539.extra: A remote attacker could trigger the "buildid" vulnerability by sending a specially crafted form to Bugzilla, leading to a persistent XSS, thus allowing for theft of credentials. With Bugzilla 2.23.3 or later, an attacker could also execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the web server by injecting a specially crafted "from" email address and gain access to normally restricted time-tracking information through the XML-RPC service.

CVE-2007-4543.title: Bugzilla: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200709-18
CVE-2007-4543.subTitle: Bugzilla contains several vulnerabilities, some of them possibly leading to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4543.background: Bugzilla is a web application designed to help with managing software development.
CVE-2007-4543.body: Masahiro Yamada found that from the 2.17.1 version, Bugzilla does not properly sanitize the content of the "buildid" parameter when filing bugs (CVE-2007-4543). The next two vulnerabilities only affect Bugzilla 2.23.3 or later, hence the stable Gentoo Portage tree does not contain these two vulnerabilities: Loic Minier reported that the "Email::Send::Sendmail()" function does not properly sanitise "from" email information before sending it to the "-f" parameter of /usr/sbin/sendmail (CVE-2007-4538), and Frederic Buclin discovered that the XML-RPC interface does not correctly check permissions in the time-tracking fields (CVE-2007-4539).
CVE-2007-4543.extra: A remote attacker could trigger the "buildid" vulnerability by sending a specially crafted form to Bugzilla, leading to a persistent XSS, thus allowing for theft of credentials. With Bugzilla 2.23.3 or later, an attacker could also execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the web server by injecting a specially crafted "from" email address and gain access to normally restricted time-tracking information through the XML-RPC service.

CVE-2007-4560.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200709-14
CVE-2007-4560.subTitle: Vulnerabilities have been discovered in ClamAV allowing remote execution of arbitrary code and Denial of Service attacks.
CVE-2007-4560.background: Clam AntiVirus is an open source (GPL) anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2007-4560.body: Nikolaos Rangos discovered a vulnerability in ClamAV which exists because the recipient address extracted from email messages is not properly sanitized before being used in a call to "popen()" when executing sendmail (CVE-2007-4560). Also, NULL-pointer dereference errors exist within the "cli_scanrtf()" function in libclamav/rtf.c and Stefanos Stamatis discovered a NULL-pointer dereference vulnerability within the "cli_html_normalise()" function in libclamav/htmlnorm.c (CVE-2007-4510).
CVE-2007-4560.extra: The unsanitized recipient address can be exploited to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the clamav-milter process by sending an email with a specially crafted recipient address to the affected system. Also, the NULL-pointer dereference errors can be exploited to crash ClamAV. Successful exploitation of the latter vulnerability requires that clamav-milter is started with the "black hole" mode activated, which is not enabled by default.

CVE-2007-4568.title: X Font Server: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-11
CVE-2007-4568.subTitle: Three vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X Font Server possibly allowing local attackers to gain elevated privileges.
CVE-2007-4568.background: The X.Org X11 X Font Server provides a standard mechanism for an X server to communicate with a font renderer.
CVE-2007-4568.body: iDefense reported that the xfs init script does not correctly handle a race condition when setting permissions of a temporary file (CVE-2007-3103). Sean Larsson discovered an integer overflow vulnerability in the build_range() function possibly leading to a heap-based buffer overflow when handling "QueryXBitmaps" and "QueryXExtents" protocol requests (CVE-2007-4568). Sean Larsson also discovered an error in the swap_char2b() function possibly leading to a heap corruption when handling the same protocol requests (CVE-2007-4990).
CVE-2007-4568.extra: The first issue would allow a local attacker to change permissions of arbitrary files to be world-writable by performing a symlink attack. The second and third issues would allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user running the X Font Server, usually xfs.

CVE-2007-4569.title: KDM: Local privilege escalation — GLSA 200710-15
CVE-2007-4569.subTitle: KDM allows logins without password under certain circumstances allowing a local user to gain elevated privileges.
CVE-2007-4569.background: KDM is the Display Manager for the graphical desktop environment KDE. It is part of the kdebase package.
CVE-2007-4569.body: Kees Huijgen discovered an error when checking the credentials which can lead to a login without specifying a password. This only occurs when auto login is configured for at least one user and a password is required to shut down the machine.
CVE-2007-4569.extra: A local attacker could gain root privileges and execute arbitrary commands by logging in as root without specifying root's password.

CVE-2007-4584.title: BitchX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200807-12
CVE-2007-4584.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in BitchX may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code or symlink attacks.
CVE-2007-4584.body: bannedit reported a boundary error when handling overly long IRC MODE messages (CVE-2007-4584). Nico Golde reported an insecure creation of a temporary file within the e_hostname() function (CVE-2007-5839).
CVE-2007-4584.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to connect to a malicious IRC server, resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files on the local machine.

CVE-2007-4619.title: FLAC: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200711-15
CVE-2007-4619.subTitle: Multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities were found in FLAC possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4619.background: The Xiph.org Free Lossless Audio Codec (FLAC) library is the reference implementation of the FLAC audio file format. It contains encoders and decoders in library and executable form.
CVE-2007-4619.body: Sean de Regge reported multiple integer overflows when processing FLAC media files that could lead to improper memory allocations resulting in heap-based buffer overflows.
CVE-2007-4619.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted FLAC file or network stream with an application using FLAC. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user playing the file.

CVE-2007-4642.title: Doomsday: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200802-02
CVE-2007-4642.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Doomsday might allow remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4642.background: The Doomsday Engine (deng) is a modern gaming engine for popular ID games like Doom, Heretic and Hexen.
CVE-2007-4642.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered multiple buffer overflows in the D_NetPlayerEvent() function, the Msg_Write() function and the NetSv_ReadCommands() function. He also discovered errors when handling chat messages that are not NULL-terminated (CVE-2007-4642) or contain a short data length, triggering an integer underflow (CVE-2007-4643). Furthermore a format string vulnerability was discovered in the Cl_GetPackets() function when processing PSV_CONSOLE_TEXT messages (CVE-2007-4644).
CVE-2007-4642.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the Doomsday server or cause a Denial of Service by sending specially crafted messages to the server.

CVE-2007-4643.title: Doomsday: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200802-02
CVE-2007-4643.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Doomsday might allow remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4643.background: The Doomsday Engine (deng) is a modern gaming engine for popular ID games like Doom, Heretic and Hexen.
CVE-2007-4643.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered multiple buffer overflows in the D_NetPlayerEvent() function, the Msg_Write() function and the NetSv_ReadCommands() function. He also discovered errors when handling chat messages that are not NULL-terminated (CVE-2007-4642) or contain a short data length, triggering an integer underflow (CVE-2007-4643). Furthermore a format string vulnerability was discovered in the Cl_GetPackets() function when processing PSV_CONSOLE_TEXT messages (CVE-2007-4644).
CVE-2007-4643.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the Doomsday server or cause a Denial of Service by sending specially crafted messages to the server.

CVE-2007-4644.title: Doomsday: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200802-02
CVE-2007-4644.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Doomsday might allow remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4644.background: The Doomsday Engine (deng) is a modern gaming engine for popular ID games like Doom, Heretic and Hexen.
CVE-2007-4644.body: Luigi Auriemma discovered multiple buffer overflows in the D_NetPlayerEvent() function, the Msg_Write() function and the NetSv_ReadCommands() function. He also discovered errors when handling chat messages that are not NULL-terminated (CVE-2007-4642) or contain a short data length, triggering an integer underflow (CVE-2007-4643). Furthermore a format string vulnerability was discovered in the Cl_GetPackets() function when processing PSV_CONSOLE_TEXT messages (CVE-2007-4644).
CVE-2007-4644.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running the Doomsday server or cause a Denial of Service by sending specially crafted messages to the server.

CVE-2007-4650.title: Gallery: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-03
CVE-2007-4650.subTitle: The WebDAV and Reupload modules of Gallery contain multiple unspecified vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-4650.background: Gallery is a PHP based photo album manager.
CVE-2007-4650.body: Merrick Manalastas and Nicklous Roberts have discovered multiple vulnerabilities in the WebDAV and Reupload modules.
CVE-2007-4650.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to bypass security restrictions and rename, replace and change properties of items, or edit item data using WebDAV.

CVE-2007-4674.title: Win32 binary codecs: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-08
CVE-2007-4674.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Win32 codecs for Linux may result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4674.background: Win32 binary codecs provide support for video and audio playback.
CVE-2007-4674.body: Multiple buffer overflow, heap overflow, and integer overflow vulnerabilities were discovered in the Quicktime plugin when processing MOV, FLC, SGI, H.264 and FPX files.
CVE-2007-4674.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted video file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-4730.title: X.Org X server: Composite local privilege escalation — GLSA 200710-16
CVE-2007-4730.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in the Composite extension of the X.Org X server, allowing for a local privilege escalation.
CVE-2007-4730.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2007-4730.body: Aaron Plattner discovered a buffer overflow in the compNewPixmap() function when copying data from a large pixel depth pixmap into a smaller pixel depth pixmap.
CVE-2007-4730.extra: A local attacker could execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the X server, typically root.

CVE-2007-4752.title: OpenSSH: Security bypass — GLSA 200711-02
CVE-2007-4752.subTitle: A flaw has been discovered in OpenSSH which could allow a local attacker to bypass security restrictions.
CVE-2007-4752.background: OpenSSH is a complete SSH protocol implementation that includes an SFTP client and server support.
CVE-2007-4752.body: Jan Pechanec discovered that OpenSSH uses a trusted X11 cookie when it cannot create an untrusted one.
CVE-2007-4752.extra: An attacker could bypass the SSH client security policy and gain privileges by causing an X client to be treated as trusted.

CVE-2007-4766.title: PCRE: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-30
CVE-2007-4766.subTitle: PCRE is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflow and memory corruption vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4766.background: PCRE is a library providing functions for Perl-compatible regular expressions.
CVE-2007-4766.body: Tavis Ormandy (Google Security) discovered multiple vulnerabilities in PCRE. He reported an error when processing "\Q\E" sequences with unmatched "\E" codes that can lead to the compiled bytecode being corrupted (CVE-2007-1659). PCRE does not properly calculate sizes for unspecified "multiple forms of character class", which triggers a buffer overflow (CVE-2007-1660). Further improper calculations of memory boundaries were reported when matching certain input bytes against regex patterns in non UTF-8 mode (CVE-2007-1661) and when searching for unmatched brackets or parentheses (CVE-2007-1662). Multiple integer overflows when processing escape sequences may lead to invalid memory read operations or potentially cause heap-based buffer overflows (CVE-2007-4766). PCRE does not properly handle "\P" and "\P{x}" sequences which can lead to heap-based buffer overflows or trigger the execution of infinite loops (CVE-2007-4767), PCRE is also prone to an error when optimizing character classes containing a singleton UTF-8 sequence which might lead to a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-4768).
CVE-2007-4766.extra: Chris Evans also reported multiple integer overflow vulnerabilities in PCRE when processing a large number of named subpatterns ("name_count") or long subpattern names ("max_name_size") (CVE-2006-7227), and via large "min", "max", or "duplength" values (CVE-2006-7228) both possibly leading to buffer overflows. Another vulnerability was reported when compiling patterns where the "-x" or "-i" UTF-8 options change within the pattern, which might lead to improper memory calculations (CVE-2006-7230).

CVE-2007-4766.title: R: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-02
CVE-2007-4766.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in R could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4766.background: R is a GPL licensed implementation of S, a language and environment for statistical computing and graphics. PCRE is a library providing functions for Perl-compatible regular expressions.
CVE-2007-4766.body: R includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-4766.extra: An attacker could entice a user to process specially crafted regular expressions with R, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-4766.title: Kazehakase: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-18
CVE-2007-4766.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Kazehakase could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4766.background: Kazehakase is a web browser based on the Gecko engine.
CVE-2007-4766.body: Kazehakase includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-4766.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted input (e.g bookmarks) with Kazehakase, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-4766.title: GOffice: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-19
CVE-2007-4766.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in GOffice could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4766.background: GOffice is a library of document-centric objects and utilities based on GTK.
CVE-2007-4766.body: GOffice includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruptions vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-4766.extra: An attacker could entice a user to open specially crafted documents with GOffice, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-4766.title: Chicken: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-11
CVE-2007-4766.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Chicken could result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4766.background: Chicken is a Scheme interpreter and native Scheme to C compiler.
CVE-2007-4766.body: Chicken includes a copy of PCRE which is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows and memory corruption vulnerabilities (GLSA 200711-30).
CVE-2007-4766.extra: An attacker could entice a user to process specially crafted regular expressions with Chicken, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service or the disclosure of sensitive information.

CVE-2007-4768.subTitle: PCRE is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflow and memory corruption vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-4769.title: PostgreSQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-15
CVE-2007-4769.subTitle: PostgreSQL contains multiple vulnerabilities that could result in privilege escalation or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4769.background: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.
CVE-2007-4769.body: If using the "expression indexes" feature, PostgreSQL executes index functions as the superuser during VACUUM and ANALYZE instead of the table owner, and allows SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION in the index functions (CVE-2007-6600). Additionally, several errors involving regular expressions were found (CVE-2007-4769, CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067). Eventually, a privilege escalation vulnerability via unspecified vectors in the DBLink module was reported (CVE-2007-6601). This vulnerability is exploitable when local trust or ident authentication is used, and is due to an incomplete fix of CVE-2007-3278.
CVE-2007-4769.extra: A remote authenticated attacker could send specially crafted queries containing complex regular expressions to the server that could result in a Denial of Service by a server crash (CVE-2007-4769), an infinite loop (CVE-2007-4772) or a memory exhaustion (CVE-2007-6067). The two other vulnerabilities can be exploited to gain additional privileges.

CVE-2007-4770.title: International Components for Unicode: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-20
CVE-2007-4770.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in the International Components for Unicode, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4770.background: International Components for Unicode is a set of C/C++ and Java libraries providing Unicode and Globalization support for software applications.
CVE-2007-4770.body: Will Drewry (Google Security) reported a vulnerability in the regular expression engine when using back references to capture \0 characters (CVE-2007-4770). He also found that the backtracking stack size is not limited, possibly allowing for a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-4771).
CVE-2007-4770.extra: A remote attacker could submit specially crafted regular expressions to an application using the library, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-4770.title: OpenOffice.org: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-16
CVE-2007-4770.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in OpenOffice.org, possibly allowing for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-4770.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2007-4770.body: iDefense Labs reported multiple vulnerabilities in OpenOffice.org:
CVE-2007-4770.extra: Furthermore, Will Drewry (Google Security) reported vulnerabilities in the memory management of the International Components for Unicode (CVE-2007-4770, CVE-2007-4771), which was resolved with GLSA 200803-20. However, the binary version of OpenOffice.org uses an internal copy of said library.

CVE-2007-4771.title: International Components for Unicode: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-20
CVE-2007-4771.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in the International Components for Unicode, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

However, the binary version of OpenOffice.org uses an internal copy of said library.

CVE-2007-4772.background: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.

The two other vulnerabilities can be exploited to gain additional privileges.

CVE-2007-4974.title: libsndfile: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-04
CVE-2007-4974.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in libsndfile.
CVE-2007-4974.background: libsndfile is a library for reading and writing various formats of audio files including WAV and FLAC.
CVE-2007-4974.body: Robert Buchholz of the Gentoo Security team discovered that the flac_buffer_copy() function does not correctly handle FLAC streams with variable block sizes which leads to a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-4974).
CVE-2007-4974.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to open a specially crafted FLAC file or network stream with an application using libsndfile. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user playing the file.

CVE-2007-4985.title: ImageMagick: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-27
CVE-2007-4985.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ImageMagick, possibly resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4985.background: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries for manipulating various image formats.
CVE-2007-4985.body: regenrecht reported multiple infinite loops in functions ReadDCMImage() and ReadXCFImage() (CVE-2007-4985), multiple integer overflows when handling certain types of images (CVE-2007-4986, CVE-2007-4988), and an off-by-one error in the ReadBlobString() function (CVE-2007-4987).
CVE-2007-4985.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or an excessive CPU consumption. Note that applications relying on ImageMagick to process images can also trigger the vulnerability.

CVE-2007-4986.title: ImageMagick: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-27
CVE-2007-4986.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ImageMagick, possibly resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4986.background: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries for manipulating various image formats.
CVE-2007-4986.body: regenrecht reported multiple infinite loops in functions ReadDCMImage() and ReadXCFImage() (CVE-2007-4985), multiple integer overflows when handling certain types of images (CVE-2007-4986, CVE-2007-4988), and an off-by-one error in the ReadBlobString() function (CVE-2007-4987).
CVE-2007-4986.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or an excessive CPU consumption. Note that applications relying on ImageMagick to process images can also trigger the vulnerability.

Note that applications relying on ImageMagick to process images can also trigger the vulnerability.

CVE-2007-4988.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ImageMagick, possibly resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4988.background: ImageMagick is a collection of tools and libraries for manipulating various image formats.

CVE-2007-4988.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted image, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or an excessive CPU consumption. Note that applications relying on ImageMagick to process images can also trigger the vulnerability.

CVE-2007-4990.title: X Font Server: Multiple Vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-11
CVE-2007-4990.subTitle: Three vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X Font Server possibly allowing local attackers to gain elevated privileges.
CVE-2007-4990.background: The X.Org X11 X Font Server provides a standard mechanism for an X server to communicate with a font renderer.
CVE-2007-4990.body: iDefense reported that the xfs init script does not correctly handle a race condition when setting permissions of a temporary file (CVE-2007-3103). Sean Larsson discovered an integer overflow vulnerability in the build_range() function possibly leading to a heap-based buffer overflow when handling "QueryXBitmaps" and "QueryXExtents" protocol requests (CVE-2007-4568). Sean Larsson also discovered an error in the swap_char2b() function possibly leading to a heap corruption when handling the same protocol requests (CVE-2007-4990).
CVE-2007-4990.extra: The first issue would allow a local attacker to change permissions of arbitrary files to be world-writable by performing a symlink attack. The second and third issues would allow a local attacker to execute arbitrary code with privileges of the user running the X Font Server, usually xfs.

CVE-2007-4992.title: Firebird: Multiple buffer overflows — GLSA 200712-06
CVE-2007-4992.subTitle: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows were discovered in Firebird.
CVE-2007-4992.background: Firebird is a multi-platfrom, open source relational database.
CVE-2007-4992.body: Adriano Lima and Ramon de Carvalho Valle reported that functions isc_attach_database() and isc_create_database() do not perform proper boundary checking when processing their input.
CVE-2007-4992.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted requests to the Firebird server on TCP port 3050, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Firebird (usually firebird).

CVE-2007-4995.title: OpenSSL: Remote execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200710-30
CVE-2007-4995.subTitle: OpenSSL contains a vulnerability allowing execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-4995.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2007-4995.body: Andy Polyakov reported a vulnerability in the OpenSSL toolkit, that is caused due to an unspecified off-by-one error within the DTLS implementation.
CVE-2007-4995.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this issue to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service. Only clients and servers explicitly using DTLS are affected, systems using SSL and TLS are not.

CVE-2007-5135.title: OpenSSL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-06
CVE-2007-5135.subTitle: A buffer underflow vulnerability and an information disclosure vulnerability have been discovered in OpenSSL.
CVE-2007-5135.background: OpenSSL is an implementation of the Secure Socket Layer and Transport Layer Security protocols.
CVE-2007-5135.body: Moritz Jodeit reported an off-by-one error in the SSL_get_shared_ciphers() function, resulting from an incomplete fix of CVE-2006-3738. A flaw has also been reported in the BN_from_montgomery() function in crypto/bn/bn_mont.c when performing Montgomery multiplication.
CVE-2007-5135.extra: A remote attacker sending a specially crafted packet to an application relying on OpenSSL could possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. A local attacker could perform a side channel attack to retrieve the RSA private keys.

CVE-2007-5137.title: Tk: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200710-07
CVE-2007-5137.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Tk.
CVE-2007-5137.background: Tk is a toolkit for creating graphical user interfaces.
CVE-2007-5137.body: Reinhard Max discovered a boundary error in Tk when processing an interlaced GIF with two frames where the second is smaller than the first one.
CVE-2007-5137.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted GIF image with a Tk-based software, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-5198.title: Nagios Plugins: Two buffer overflows — GLSA 200711-11
CVE-2007-5198.subTitle: Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the Nagios Plugins might allow for remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5198.background: The Nagios Plugins are an official set of plugins for Nagios, an open source host, service and network monitoring program.
CVE-2007-5198.body: fabiodds reported a boundary checking error in the "check_snmp" plugin when processing SNMP "GET" replies that could lead to a stack-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-5623). Nobuhiro Ban reported a boundary checking error in the redir() function of the "check_http" plugin when processing HTTP "Location:" header information which might lead to a buffer overflow (CVE-2007-5198).
CVE-2007-5198.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Nagios or cause a Denial of Service by (1) sending a specially crafted SNMP "GET" reply to the Nagios daemon or (2) sending an overly long string in the "Location:" header of an HTTP reply. Note that to exploit (2), the malicious or compromised web server has to be configured in Nagios and the "-f" (follow) option has to be enabled.

CVE-2007-5208.title: HPLIP: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200710-26
CVE-2007-5208.subTitle: The hpssd daemon might allow local attackers to execute arbitrary commands with root privileges.
CVE-2007-5208.background: The Hewlett-Packard Linux Imaging and Printing system (HPLIP) provides drivers for HP's inkjet and laser printers, scanners and fax machines. It integrates with the Common UNIX Printing System (CUPS) and Scanner Access Now Easy (SANE).
CVE-2007-5208.body: Kees Cook from the Ubuntu Security team discovered that the hpssd daemon does not correctly validate user supplied data before passing it to a "popen3()" call.
CVE-2007-5208.extra: A local attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted request to the hpssd daemon to execute arbitrary commands with the privileges of the user running hpssd, usually root.

CVE-2007-5237.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-5237.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-5237.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-5237.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-5237.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-5238.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-5238.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-5238.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-5238.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-5238.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-5239.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2007-5239.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2007-5239.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2007-5239.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2007-5239.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-5246.title: Firebird: Multiple buffer overflows — GLSA 200712-06
CVE-2007-5246.subTitle: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows were discovered in Firebird.
CVE-2007-5246.background: Firebird is a multi-platfrom, open source relational database.
CVE-2007-5246.body: Adriano Lima and Ramon de Carvalho Valle reported that functions isc_attach_database() and isc_create_database() do not perform proper boundary checking when processing their input.
CVE-2007-5246.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted requests to the Firebird server on TCP port 3050, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Firebird (usually firebird).

CVE-2007-5269.title: VMware Player, Server, Workstation: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-25
CVE-2007-5269.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation, allowing remote and local attackers to conduct several attacks, including privilege escalation, remote execution of arbitrary code, and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-5269.background: VMware Player, Server, and Workstation allow emulation of a complete PC on a PC without the usual performance overhead of most emulators.
CVE-2007-5269.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2007-5269.extra: Local users may be able to gain escalated privileges, cause a Denial of Service, or gain sensitive information.

CVE-2007-5333.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Tomcat may lead to local file overwriting, session hijacking or information disclosure.

CVE-2007-5339.title: Mozilla Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-24
CVE-2007-5339.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird, which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-5339.background: Mozilla Thunderbird is a popular open-source email client from the Mozilla project.
CVE-2007-5339.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird's HTML browser engine (CVE-2007-5339) and JavaScript engine (CVE-2007-5340) that can be exploited to cause a memory corruption.
CVE-2007-5339.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to read a specially crafted email that could trigger one of the vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-5340.title: Mozilla Thunderbird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-24
CVE-2007-5340.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird, which may allow user-assisted arbitrary remote code execution.
CVE-2007-5340.background: Mozilla Thunderbird is a popular open-source email client from the Mozilla project.
CVE-2007-5340.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Thunderbird's HTML browser engine (CVE-2007-5339) and JavaScript engine (CVE-2007-5340) that can be exploited to cause a memory corruption.
CVE-2007-5340.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to read a specially crafted email that could trigger one of the vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-5342.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Tomcat may lead to local file overwriting, session hijacking or information disclosure.
CVE-2007-5342.background: Tomcat is the Apache Jakarta Project's official implementation of Java Servlets and Java Server Pages.
CVE-2007-5342.extra: These vulnerabilities can be exploited by:

CVE-2007-5379.title: Ruby on Rails: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-17
CVE-2007-5379.subTitle: Several vulnerabilities were found in Ruby on Rails allowing for file disclosure and theft of user credentials.
CVE-2007-5379.background: Ruby on Rails is a free web framework used to develop database-driven web applications.
CVE-2007-5379.body: candlerb found that ActiveResource, when processing responses using the Hash.from_xml() function, does not properly sanitize filenames (CVE-2007-5380). The session management functionality allowed the "session_id" to be set in the URL (CVE-2007-5380). BCC discovered that the to_json() function does not properly sanitize input before returning it to the user (CVE-2007-3227).
CVE-2007-5379.extra: Unauthenticated remote attackers could exploit these vulnerabilities to determine the existence of files or to read the contents of arbitrary XML files; conduct session fixation attacks and gain unauthorized access; and to execute arbitrary HTML and script code in a user's browser session in context of an affected site by enticing a user to browse a specially crafted URL.

CVE-2007-5392.title: Poppler, KDE: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200711-22
CVE-2007-5392.subTitle: Poppler and various KDE components are vulnerable to multiple memory management issues possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5392.background: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf. KOffice is an integrated office suite for KDE. KWord is the KOffice word processor. KPDF is a KDE-based PDF viewer included in the kdegraphics package.
CVE-2007-5392.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) discovered several vulnerabilities in the "Stream.cc" file of Xpdf: An integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() method and a boundary error in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() method, both leading to heap-based buffer overflows (CVE-2007-5392, CVE-2007-5393). He also discovered a boundary checking error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() method causing memory corruption (CVE-2007-4352). Note: Gentoo's version of Xpdf is patched to use the Poppler library, so the update to Poppler will also fix Xpdf.
CVE-2007-5392.extra: By enticing a user to view or process a specially crafted PDF file with KWord or KPDF or a Poppler-based program such as Gentoo's viewers Xpdf, ePDFView, and Evince or the CUPS printing system, a remote attacker could cause an overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-5392.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-34
CVE-2007-5392.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5392.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-5392.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-5392.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-5392.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-5392.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5392.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-5392.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-5392.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.

CVE-2007-5393.title: Poppler, KDE: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200711-22
CVE-2007-5393.subTitle: Poppler and various KDE components are vulnerable to multiple memory management issues possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5393.background: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf. KOffice is an integrated office suite for KDE. KWord is the KOffice word processor. KPDF is a KDE-based PDF viewer included in the kdegraphics package.
CVE-2007-5393.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) discovered several vulnerabilities in the "Stream.cc" file of Xpdf: An integer overflow in the DCTStream::reset() method and a boundary error in the CCITTFaxStream::lookChar() method, both leading to heap-based buffer overflows (CVE-2007-5392, CVE-2007-5393). He also discovered a boundary checking error in the DCTStream::readProgressiveDataUnit() method causing memory corruption (CVE-2007-4352). Note: Gentoo's version of Xpdf is patched to use the Poppler library, so the update to Poppler will also fix Xpdf.
CVE-2007-5393.extra: By enticing a user to view or process a specially crafted PDF file with KWord or KPDF or a Poppler-based program such as Gentoo's viewers Xpdf, ePDFView, and Evince or the CUPS printing system, a remote attacker could cause an overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-5393.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-34
CVE-2007-5393.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5393.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.

CVE-2007-5393.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-5393.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-5393.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5393.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-5393.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-5393.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.

CVE-2007-5395.title: Link Grammar: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200711-27
CVE-2007-5395.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Link Grammar.
CVE-2007-5395.background: The Link Grammar parser is a syntactic parser of English, based on link grammar, an original theory of English syntax.
CVE-2007-5395.body: Alin Rad Pop from Secunia Research discovered a boundary error in the function separate_sentence() in file tokenize.c when processing an overly long word which might lead to a stack-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-5395.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to parse a specially crafted sentence, resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Note that this vulnerability may be triggered by an application using Link Grammar to parse sentences (e.g. AbiWord).

CVE-2007-5461.title: Tomcat: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-10
CVE-2007-5461.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Tomcat may lead to local file overwriting, session hijacking or information disclosure.
CVE-2007-5461.background: Tomcat is the Apache Jakarta Project's official implementation of Java Servlets and Java Server Pages.
CVE-2007-5461.extra: These vulnerabilities can be exploited by:

CVE-2007-5503.title: Cairo: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200712-04
CVE-2007-5503.subTitle: Multiple integer overflows were discovered in Cairo, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5503.background: Cairo is a 2D vector graphics library with cross-device output support.
CVE-2007-5503.body: Multiple integer overflows were reported, one of which Peter Valchev (Google Security) found to be leading to a heap-based buffer overflow in the cairo_image_surface_create_from_png() function that processes PNG images.
CVE-2007-5503.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to view or process a specially crafted PNG image file in an application linked against Cairo, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-5503.title: VMware Player, Server, Workstation: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-25
CVE-2007-5503.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation, allowing remote and local attackers to conduct several attacks, including privilege escalation, remote execution of arbitrary code, and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-5503.background: VMware Player, Server, and Workstation allow emulation of a complete PC on a PC without the usual performance overhead of most emulators.
CVE-2007-5503.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2007-5503.extra: Local users may be able to gain escalated privileges, cause a Denial of Service, or gain sensitive information.

CVE-2007-5540.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-31
CVE-2007-5540.subTitle: Opera contains multiple vulnerabilities, which may allow the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5540.background: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.
CVE-2007-5540.body: Michael A. Puls II discovered an unspecified flaw when launching external email or newsgroup clients (CVE-2007-5541). David Bloom discovered that when displaying frames from different websites, the same-origin policy is not correctly enforced (CVE-2007-5540).
CVE-2007-5540.extra: An attacker could potentially exploit the first vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Opera by enticing a user to visit a specially crafted URL. Note that this vulnerability requires an external e-mail or newsgroup client configured in Opera to be exploitable. The second vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a user's browser session in context of other sites or the theft of browser credentials.

CVE-2007-5541.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200710-31
CVE-2007-5541.subTitle: Opera contains multiple vulnerabilities, which may allow the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5541.background: Opera is a multi-platform web browser.
CVE-2007-5541.body: Michael A. Puls II discovered an unspecified flaw when launching external email or newsgroup clients (CVE-2007-5541). David Bloom discovered that when displaying frames from different websites, the same-origin policy is not correctly enforced (CVE-2007-5540).
CVE-2007-5541.extra: An attacker could potentially exploit the first vulnerability to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Opera by enticing a user to visit a specially crafted URL. Note that this vulnerability requires an external e-mail or newsgroup client configured in Opera to be exploitable. The second vulnerability allows an attacker to execute arbitrary script code in a user's browser session in context of other sites or the theft of browser credentials.

CVE-2007-5622.title: 3proxy: Denial of service — GLSA 200711-13
CVE-2007-5622.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in 3proxy, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-5622.background: 3proxy is a really tiny cross-platform proxy servers set, including HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SOCKS and POP3 support.
CVE-2007-5622.body: 3proxy contains a double free vulnerability in the ftpprchild() function, which frees param->hostname and calls the parsehostname() function, which in turn attempts to free param->hostname again.
CVE-2007-5622.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to the proxy, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service. Under typical configuration, the scope of this vulnerability is limited to the local network.

CVE-2007-5623.title: Nagios Plugins: Two buffer overflows — GLSA 200711-11
CVE-2007-5623.subTitle: Two buffer overflow vulnerabilities in the Nagios Plugins might allow for remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5623.background: The Nagios Plugins are an official set of plugins for Nagios, an open source host, service and network monitoring program.
CVE-2007-5623.body: fabiodds reported a boundary checking error in the "check_snmp" plugin when processing SNMP "GET" replies that could lead to a stack-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-5623). Nobuhiro Ban reported a boundary checking error in the redir() function of the "check_http" plugin when processing HTTP "Location:" header information which might lead to a buffer overflow (CVE-2007-5198).
CVE-2007-5623.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Nagios or cause a Denial of Service by (1) sending a specially crafted SNMP "GET" reply to the Nagios daemon or (2) sending an overly long string in the "Location:" header of an HTTP reply. Note that to exploit (2), the malicious or compromised web server has to be configured in Nagios and the "-f" (follow) option has to be enabled.

CVE-2007-5626.title: Bacula: Information disclosure — GLSA 200807-10
CVE-2007-5626.subTitle: A vulnerability in Bacula may allow local attackers to obtain sensitive information.
CVE-2007-5626.background: Bacula is a network based backup suite.
CVE-2007-5626.body: Matthijs Kooijman reported that the "make_catalog_backup" script uses the MySQL password as a command line argument when invoking other programs.
CVE-2007-5626.extra: A local attacker could list the processes on the local machine when the script is running to obtain the MySQL password. Note: The password could also be disclosed via network sniffing attacks when the script fails, in which case it would be sent via cleartext e-mail.

CVE-2007-5659.title: Adobe Acrobat Reader: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-01
CVE-2007-5659.subTitle: Adobe Acrobat Reader is vulnerable to remote code execution, Denial of Service, and cross-site request forgery attacks.
CVE-2007-5659.background: Adobe Acrobat Reader is a PDF reader released by Adobe.
CVE-2007-5659.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Acrobat Reader, including:
CVE-2007-5659.extra: Other unspecified vulnerabilities have also been reported (CVE-2008-0655).

CVE-2007-5707.title: OpenLDAP: Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-28
CVE-2007-5707.subTitle: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been reported in OpenLDAP.
CVE-2007-5707.background: OpenLDAP Software is an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.
CVE-2007-5707.body: The following errors have been discovered in OpenLDAP:
CVE-2007-5707.extra: A remote attacker can cause a Denial of Serivce by sending a malformed "objectClasses" attribute, and via unknown vectors that prevent the "new_attrs" array from being NULL terminated, and via a modrdn operation with a NOOP (LDAP_X_NO_OPERATION) control.

CVE-2007-5708.title: OpenLDAP: Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-28
CVE-2007-5708.subTitle: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been reported in OpenLDAP.
CVE-2007-5708.background: OpenLDAP Software is an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.
CVE-2007-5708.body: The following errors have been discovered in OpenLDAP:
CVE-2007-5708.extra: A remote attacker can cause a Denial of Serivce by sending a malformed "objectClasses" attribute, and via unknown vectors that prevent the "new_attrs" array from being NULL terminated, and via a modrdn operation with a NOOP (LDAP_X_NO_OPERATION) control.

CVE-2007-5714.title: MLDonkey: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200710-25
CVE-2007-5714.subTitle: The Gentoo MLDonkey ebuild adds a user to the system with a valid login shell and no password.
CVE-2007-5714.background: MLDonkey is a peer-to-peer filesharing client that connects to several different peer-to-peer networks, including Overnet and BitTorrent.
CVE-2007-5714.body: The Gentoo MLDonkey ebuild adds a user to the system named "p2p" so that the MLDonkey service can run under a user with low privileges. With older Portage versions this user is created with a valid login shell and no password.
CVE-2007-5714.extra: A remote attacker could log into a vulnerable system as the p2p user. This would require an installed login service that permitted empty passwords, such as SSH configured with the "PermitEmptyPasswords yes" option, a local login console, or a telnet server.

CVE-2007-5745.title: OpenOffice.org: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-16
CVE-2007-5745.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in OpenOffice.org, possibly allowing for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-5745.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2007-5745.body: iDefense Labs reported multiple vulnerabilities in OpenOffice.org:
CVE-2007-5745.extra: Furthermore, Will Drewry (Google Security) reported vulnerabilities in the memory management of the International Components for Unicode (CVE-2007-4770, CVE-2007-4771), which was resolved with GLSA 200803-20. However, the binary version of OpenOffice.org uses an internal copy of said library.
