CVE-2007-5846.title: Net-SNMP: Denial of service — GLSA 200711-31
CVE-2007-5846.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been discovered in Net-SNMP when processing GETBULK requests.
CVE-2007-5846.background: Net-SNMP is a collection of tools for generating and retrieving SNMP data.
CVE-2007-5846.body: The SNMP agent (snmpd) does not properly handle GETBULK requests with an overly large "max-repetitions" field.
CVE-2007-5846.extra: A remote unauthenticated attacker could send a specially crafted SNMP request to the vulnerable application, possibly resulting in a high CPU and memory consumption.

CVE-2007-5901.title: MIT Kerberos 5: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-31
CVE-2007-5901.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MIT Kerberos 5, which could allow a remote unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2007-5901.background: MIT Kerberos 5 is a suite of applications that implement the Kerberos network protocol. kadmind is the MIT Kerberos 5 administration daemon, KDC is the Key Distribution Center.
CVE-2007-5901.body: The first two vulnerabilities can be exploited by a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the host running krb5kdc, compromise the Kerberos key database or cause a Denial of Service. These bugs can only be triggered when Kerberos 4 support is enabled.
CVE-2007-5901.extra: The RPC related vulnerability can be exploited by a remote unauthenticated attacker to crash kadmind, and theoretically execute arbitrary code with root privileges or cause database corruption. This bug can only be triggered in configurations that allow large numbers of open file descriptors in a process.

CVE-2007-5925.title: MySQL: Denial of service — GLSA 200711-25
CVE-2007-5925.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability was found in MySQL.
CVE-2007-5925.background: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server.
CVE-2007-5925.body: Joe Gallo and Artem Russakovskii reported an error in the convert_search_mode_to_innobase() function in ha_innodb.cc in the InnoDB engine that is leading to a failed assertion when handling CONTAINS operations.
CVE-2007-5925.extra: A remote authenticated attacker with ALTER privileges could send a specially crafted request to a vulnerable database server possibly leading to a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-5933.title: Pioneers: Multiple Denials of Service — GLSA 200711-20
CVE-2007-5933.subTitle: Two Denial of Service vulnerabilities were discovered in Pioneers.
CVE-2007-5933.background: Pioneers (formerly gnocatan) is a clone of the popular board game "The Settlers of Catan".
CVE-2007-5933.body: Roland Clobus discovered that the Pioneers server may free sessions objects while they are still in use, resulting in access to invalid memory zones (CVE-2007-5933). Bas Wijnen discovered an error when closing connections which can lead to a failed assertion (CVE-2007-6010).
CVE-2007-5933.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted data to the vulnerable server, resulting in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-5934.title: PEAR::MDB2: Information disclosure — GLSA 200712-05
CVE-2007-5934.subTitle: A vulnerability when handling database input in PEAR::MDB2 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information.
CVE-2007-5934.background: PEAR::MDB2 is a database abstraction layer for PHP aimed to provide a common API for all supported relational database management systems. A LOB ("large object") is a database field holding binary data.
CVE-2007-5934.body: priyadi discovered that the request to store a URL string as a LOB is treated as a request to retrieve and store the contents of the URL.
CVE-2007-5934.extra: If an application using PEAR::MDB2 allows input of LOB values via a web form, remote attackers could use the application as an indirect proxy or obtain sensitive information, including "file://" URLs local to the web server.

CVE-2007-5935.title: teTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-26
CVE-2007-5935.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in teTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5935.background: teTeX is a complete TeX distribution for editing documents.
CVE-2007-5935.body: Joachim Schrod discovered several buffer overflow vulnerabilities and an insecure temporary file creation in the "dvilj" application that is used by dvips to convert DVI files to printer formats (CVE-2007-5937, CVE-2007-5936). Bastien Roucaries reported that the "dvips" application is vulnerable to two stack-based buffer overflows when processing DVI documents with long \href{} URIs (CVE-2007-5935). teTeX also includes code from Xpdf that is vulnerable to a memory corruption and two heap-based buffer overflows (GLSA 200711-22); and it contains code from T1Lib that is vulnerable to a buffer overflow when processing an overly long font filename (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-5935.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted DVI or PDF file which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. A local attacker could exploit the "dvilj" vulnerability to conduct a symlink attack to overwrite arbitrary files.

CVE-2007-5935.title: CSTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200711-34
CVE-2007-5935.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in CSTeX, possibly allowing to execute arbitrary code or overwrite arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5935.background: CSTeX is a TeX distribution with Czech and Slovak support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-5935.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that CSTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). CSTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-5935.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running CSTeX via multiple vectors.

CVE-2007-5935.title: PTeX: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-13
CVE-2007-5935.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in PTeX, possibly allowing the execution of arbitrary code or overwriting arbitrary files.
CVE-2007-5935.background: PTeX is a TeX distribution with Japanese support. It is used for creating and manipulating LaTeX documents.
CVE-2007-5935.body: Multiple issues were found in the teTeX 2 codebase that PTeX builds upon (GLSA 200709-17, GLSA 200711-26). PTeX also includes vulnerable code from the GD library (GLSA 200708-05), from Xpdf (GLSA 200709-12, GLSA 200711-22) and from T1Lib (GLSA 200710-12).
CVE-2007-5935.extra: Remote attackers could possibly execute arbitrary code and local attackers could possibly overwrite arbitrary files with the privileges of the user running PTeX via multiple vectors, e.g. enticing users to open specially crafted files.

CVE-2007-5947.title: Mozilla Firefox, SeaMonkey: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-21
CVE-2007-5947.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Seamonkey.
CVE-2007-5947.background: Mozilla Firefox is a cross-platform web browser from Mozilla. SeaMonkey is a free, cross-platform Internet suite.
CVE-2007-5947.body: Jesse Ruderman and Petko D. Petkov reported that the jar protocol handler in Mozilla Firefox and Seamonkey does not properly check MIME types (CVE-2007-5947). Gregory Fleischer reported that the window.location property can be used to generate a fake HTTP Referer (CVE-2007-5960). Multiple memory errors have also been reported (CVE-2007-5959).
CVE-2007-5947.extra: A remote attacker could possibly exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the browser and conduct Cross-Site-Scripting or Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.

CVE-2007-5958.title: X.Org X server and Xfont library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-09
CVE-2007-5958.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server and Xfont library, allowing for a local privilege escalation and arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2007-5958.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2007-5958.body: regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extension via iDefense:
CVE-2007-5958.extra: Remote attackers could exploit the vulnerability in the Xfont library by enticing a user to load a specially crafted PCF font file resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the X server, typically root. Local attackers could exploit this and the vulnerabilities in the X.org extensions to gain elevated privileges. If the X server allows connections from the network, these vulnerabilities could be exploited remotely. A local attacker could determine the existence of arbitrary files by exploiting the last vulnerability or possibly cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-5958.title: NX: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-05
CVE-2007-5958.subTitle: NX uses code from the X.org X11 server which is prone to multiple vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-5958.background: NoMachine's NX establishes remote connections to X11 desktops over small bandwidth links. NX and NX Node are the compression core libraries, whereas NX is used by FreeNX and NX Node by the binary-only NX servers.
CVE-2007-5958.body: Multiple integer overflow and buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server as shipped by NX and NX Node (vulnerabilities 1-4 in GLSA 200801-09).
CVE-2007-5958.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities via unspecified vectors, leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user on the machine running the NX server.

CVE-2007-5960.title: Mozilla Firefox, SeaMonkey: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-21
CVE-2007-5960.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Mozilla Firefox and Mozilla Seamonkey.
CVE-2007-5960.background: Mozilla Firefox is a cross-platform web browser from Mozilla. SeaMonkey is a free, cross-platform Internet suite.
CVE-2007-5960.body: Jesse Ruderman and Petko D. Petkov reported that the jar protocol handler in Mozilla Firefox and Seamonkey does not properly check MIME types (CVE-2007-5947). Gregory Fleischer reported that the window.location property can be used to generate a fake HTTP Referer (CVE-2007-5960). Multiple memory errors have also been reported (CVE-2007-5959).
CVE-2007-5960.extra: A remote attacker could possibly exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code in the context of the browser and conduct Cross-Site-Scripting or Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks.

CVE-2007-5969.title: MySQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-04
CVE-2007-5969.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in MySQL might lead to privilege escalation and Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-5969.background: MySQL is a popular multi-threaded, multi-user SQL server.
CVE-2007-5969.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in MySQL:
CVE-2007-5969.extra: An authenticated remote attacker could exploit the first vulnerability to overwrite MySQL system tables and escalate privileges, or use the second vulnerability to gain privileges via an "ALTER VIEW" statement. Remote federated MySQL servers could cause a Denial of Service in the local MySQL server by exploiting the third vulnerability.

CVE-2007-5971.title: MIT Kerberos 5: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-31
CVE-2007-5971.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MIT Kerberos 5, which could allow a remote unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2007-5971.background: MIT Kerberos 5 is a suite of applications that implement the Kerberos network protocol. kadmind is the MIT Kerberos 5 administration daemon, KDC is the Key Distribution Center.
CVE-2007-5971.body: The first two vulnerabilities can be exploited by a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the host running krb5kdc, compromise the Kerberos key database or cause a Denial of Service. These bugs can only be triggered when Kerberos 4 support is enabled.
CVE-2007-5971.extra: The RPC related vulnerability can be exploited by a remote unauthenticated attacker to crash kadmind, and theoretically execute arbitrary code with root privileges or cause database corruption. This bug can only be triggered in configurations that allow large numbers of open file descriptors in a process.

CVE-2007-6015.title: Samba: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200712-10
CVE-2007-6015.subTitle: Samba contains a buffer overflow vulnerability potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-6015.background: Samba is a suite of SMB and CIFS client/server programs for UNIX.
CVE-2007-6015.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) discovered a boundary checking error in the send_mailslot() function which could lead to a stack-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-6015.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted "SAMLOGON" domain logon packet, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with elevated privileges. Note that this vulnerability is exploitable only when domain logon support is enabled in Samba, which is not the case in Gentoo's default configuration.

CVE-2007-6035.title: Cacti: SQL injection — GLSA 200712-02
CVE-2007-6035.subTitle: An SQL injection vulnerability has been discovered in Cacti.
CVE-2007-6035.background: Cacti is a complete web-based frontend to rrdtool.
CVE-2007-6035.body: It has been reported that the "local_graph_id" variable used in the file graph.php is not properly sanitized before being processed in an SQL statement.
CVE-2007-6035.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to the vulnerable host, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary SQL code.

CVE-2007-6036.title: LIVE555 Media Server: Denial of service — GLSA 200803-22
CVE-2007-6036.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been reported in LIVE555 Media Server.
CVE-2007-6036.background: LIVE555 Media Server is a set of libraries for multimedia streaming.
CVE-2007-6036.body: Luigi Auriemma reported a signedness error in the parseRTSPRequestString() function when processing short RTSP queries.
CVE-2007-6036.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted RTSP query to the vulnerable server, resulting in a crash.

CVE-2007-6067.title: PostgreSQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-15
CVE-2007-6067.subTitle: PostgreSQL contains multiple vulnerabilities that could result in privilege escalation or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6067.background: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.
CVE-2007-6067.body: If using the "expression indexes" feature, PostgreSQL executes index functions as the superuser during VACUUM and ANALYZE instead of the table owner, and allows SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION in the index functions (CVE-2007-6600). Additionally, several errors involving regular expressions were found (CVE-2007-4769, CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067). Eventually, a privilege escalation vulnerability via unspecified vectors in the DBLink module was reported (CVE-2007-6601). This vulnerability is exploitable when local trust or ident authentication is used, and is due to an incomplete fix of CVE-2007-3278.
CVE-2007-6067.extra: A remote authenticated attacker could send specially crafted queries containing complex regular expressions to the server that could result in a Denial of Service by a server crash (CVE-2007-4769), an infinite loop (CVE-2007-4772) or a memory exhaustion (CVE-2007-6067). The two other vulnerabilities can be exploited to gain additional privileges.

CVE-2007-6109.title: GNU Emacs: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-03
CVE-2007-6109.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities were found in GNU Emacs possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-6109.background: GNU Emacs is a highly extensible and customizable text editor.
CVE-2007-6109.body: Drake Wilson reported that the hack-local-variables() function in GNU Emacs 22 does not properly match assignments of local variables in a file against a list of unsafe or risky variables, allowing to override them (CVE-2007-5795). Andreas Schwab (SUSE) discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the format function when handling values with high precision (CVE-2007-6109).
CVE-2007-6109.extra: Remote attackers could entice a user to open a specially crafted file in GNU Emacs, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary Emacs Lisp code (via CVE-2007-5795) or arbitrary code (via CVE-2007-6109) with the privileges of the user running GNU Emacs.

CVE-2007-6112.title: Wireshark: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-23
CVE-2007-6112.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6112.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2007-6112.body: Multiple buffer overflows and infinite loops were discovered in multiple dissector and parser components, including those for MP3 and NCP (CVE-2007-6111), PPP (CVE-2007-6112), DNP (CVE-2007-6113), SSL and iSeries (OS/400) Communication traces (CVE-2007-6114), ANSI MAP (CVE-2007-6115), Firebird/Interbase (CVE-2007-6116), HTTP (CVE-2007-6117), MEGACO (CVE-2007-6118), DCP ETSI (CVE-2007-6119), Bluetooth SDP (CVE-2007-6120), RPC Portmap (CVE-2007-6121), SMB (CVE-2007-6438), IPv6 amd USB (CVE-2007-6439), WiMAX (CVE-2007-6441), RPL (CVE-2007-6450), CIP (CVE-2007-6451). The vulnerabilities were discovered by Stefan Esser, Beyond Security, Fabiodds, Peter Leeming, Steve and ainsley.
CVE-2007-6112.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted packets on a network being monitored with Wireshark or entice a user to open a specially crafted file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Wireshark (which might be the root user), or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6122.title: IRC Services: Denial of service — GLSA 200712-12
CVE-2007-6122.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been reported in IRC Services.
CVE-2007-6122.background: IRC Services is a system of services to be used with Internet Relay Chat networks.
CVE-2007-6122.body: loverboy reported that the "default_encrypt()" function in file encrypt.c does not properly handle overly long passwords.
CVE-2007-6122.extra: A remote attacker could provide an overly long password to the vulnerable server, resulting in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6166.title: Win32 binary codecs: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-08
CVE-2007-6166.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Win32 codecs for Linux may result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-6166.background: Win32 binary codecs provide support for video and audio playback.
CVE-2007-6166.body: Multiple buffer overflow, heap overflow, and integer overflow vulnerabilities were discovered in the Quicktime plugin when processing MOV, FLC, SGI, H.264 and FPX files.
CVE-2007-6166.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted video file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-6170.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-13
CVE-2007-6170.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for SQL injection, session hijacking and unauthorized usage.
CVE-2007-6170.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and tool kit.
CVE-2007-6170.body: Asterisk upstream developers reported multiple vulnerabilities:
CVE-2007-6170.extra: Remote authenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk to execute arbitrary SQL commands and compromise the administrative database. Remote unauthenticated attackers could bypass authentication using a valid username to hijack other user's sessions, and establish sessions on the SIP channel without authentication.

CVE-2007-6203.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-19
CVE-2007-6203.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache.
CVE-2007-6203.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2007-6203.body: Adrian Pastor and Amir Azam (ProCheckUp) reported that the HTTP Method specifier header is not properly sanitized when the HTTP return code is "413 Request Entity too large" (CVE-2007-6203). The mod_proxy_balancer module does not properly check the balancer name before using it (CVE-2007-6422). The mod_proxy_ftp does not define a charset in its answers (CVE-2008-0005). Stefano Di Paola (Minded Security) reported that filenames are not properly sanitized within the mod_negotiation module (CVE-2008-0455, CVE-2008-0456).
CVE-2007-6203.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to visit a malicious URL or send specially crafted HTTP requests (i.e using Adobe Flash) to perform Cross-Site Scripting and HTTP response splitting attacks, or conduct a Denial of Service attack on the vulnerable web server.

CVE-2007-6239.title: Squid: Denial of service — GLSA 200801-05
CVE-2007-6239.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been reported in Squid.
CVE-2007-6239.background: Squid is a multi-protocol proxy server.
CVE-2007-6239.body: The Wikimedia Foundation reported a memory leak vulnerability when performing cache updates.
CVE-2007-6239.extra: A remote attacker could perform numerous specially crafted requests to the vulnerable server, resulting in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6239.title: Squid: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-38
CVE-2007-6239.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Squid which allow for remote Denial of Service attacks.
CVE-2007-6239.background: Squid is a full-featured web proxy cache.
CVE-2007-6239.body: The issues allows for Denial of Service attacks against the service via an HTTP request with an invalid version number and other specially crafted requests.
CVE-2007-6239.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2007-6284.title: libxml2: Denial of service — GLSA 200801-20
CVE-2007-6284.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been reported in libxml2.
CVE-2007-6284.background: libxml2 is the XML (eXtended Markup Language) C parser and toolkit initially developed for the Gnome project.
CVE-2007-6284.body: Brad Fitzpatrick reported that the xmlCurrentChar() function does not properly handle some UTF-8 multibyte encodings.
CVE-2007-6284.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted XML document with an application using libxml2, possibly resulting in a high CPU consumption. Note that this vulnerability could also be triggered without user interaction by an automated system processing XML content.

CVE-2007-6335.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-20
CVE-2007-6335.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ClamAV allowing remote execution of arbitrary code and Denial of Service attacks.
CVE-2007-6335.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2007-6335.body: iDefense reported an integer overflow vulnerability in the cli_scanpe() function when parsing Portable Executable (PE) files packed in the MEW format, that could be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-6335). Toeroek Edwin reported an off-by-one error when decompressing MS-ZIP compressed CAB files (CVE-2007-6336). An unspecified vulnerability related to the bzip2 decompression algorithm has also been discovered (CVE-2007-6337).
CVE-2007-6335.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised).

CVE-2007-6336.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-20
CVE-2007-6336.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in ClamAV allowing remote execution of arbitrary code and Denial of Service attacks.

CVE-2007-6336.body: iDefense reported an integer overflow vulnerability in the cli_scanpe() function when parsing Portable Executable (PE) files packed in the MEW format, that could be exploited to cause a heap-based buffer overflow (CVE-2007-6335). Toeroek Edwin reported an off-by-one error when decompressing MS-ZIP compressed CAB files (CVE-2007-6336). An unspecified vulnerability related to the bzip2 decompression algorithm has also been discovered (CVE-2007-6337).
CVE-2007-6336.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised).

CVE-2007-6350.title: scponly: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200802-06
CVE-2007-6350.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in scponly allow authenticated users to bypass security restrictions.
CVE-2007-6350.background: scponly is a shell for restricting user access to file transfer only using sftp and scp.
CVE-2007-6350.body: Joachim Breitner reported that Subversion and rsync support invokes subcommands in an insecure manner (CVE-2007-6350). It has also been discovered that scponly does not filter the -o and -F options to the scp executable (CVE-2007-6415).
CVE-2007-6350.extra: A local attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to elevate privileges and execute arbitrary commands on the vulnerable host.

CVE-2007-6352.title: libexif: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-15
CVE-2007-6352.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities in libexif possibly allow for the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6352.background: libexif is a library for parsing, editing and saving Exif metadata from images. Exif, the Exchangeable image file format, specifies the addition of metadata tags to JPEG, TIFF and RIFF files.
CVE-2007-6352.body: Meder Kydyraliev (Google Security) discovered an integer overflow vulnerability in the exif_data_load_data_thumbnail() function leading to a memory corruption (CVE-2007-6352) and an infinite recursion in the exif_loader_write() function (CVE-2007-6351).
CVE-2007-6352.extra: An attacker could entice the user of an application making use of libexif to load an image file with specially crafted Exif tags, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6353.title: Exiv2: Integer overflow — GLSA 200712-16
CVE-2007-6353.subTitle: An integer overflow vulnerability in Exiv2 possibly allows for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-6353.background: Exiv2 is a C++ library and set of tools for parsing, editing and saving Exif and IPTC metadata from images. Exif, the Exchangeable image file format, specifies the addition of metadata tags to JPEG, TIFF and RIFF files.
CVE-2007-6353.body: Meder Kydyraliev (Google Security) discovered an integer overflow vulnerability in the JpegThumbnail::setDataArea() method leading to a heap-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2007-6353.extra: An attacker could entice the user of an application making use of Exiv2 or an application included in Exiv2 to load an image file with specially crafted Exif tags, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-6355.title: exiftags: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-17
CVE-2007-6355.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in exiftags possibly allow for the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6355.background: exiftags is a library and set of tools for parsing, editing and saving Exif metadata from images. Exif, the Exchangeable image file format, specifies the addition of metadata tags to JPEG, TIFF and RIFF files.
CVE-2007-6355.body: Meder Kydyraliev (Google Security) discovered that Exif metadata is not properly sanitized before being processed, resulting in illegal memory access in the postprop() and other functions (CVE-2007-6354). He also discovered integer overflow vulnerabilities in the parsetag() and other functions (CVE-2007-6355) and an infinite recursion in the readifds() function caused by recursive IFD references (CVE-2007-6356).
CVE-2007-6355.extra: An attacker could entice the user of an application making use of exiftags or an application included in exiftags to load an image file with specially crafted Exif tags, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6420.title: Apache: Denial of service — GLSA 200807-06
CVE-2007-6420.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Apache might lead to a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6420.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2007-6420.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache:
CVE-2007-6420.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by connecting to an Apache httpd, by causing an Apache proxy server to connect to a malicious server, or by enticing a balancer administrator to connect to a specially-crafted URL, resulting in a Denial of Service of the Apache daemon.

CVE-2007-6427.title: X.Org X server and Xfont library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-09
CVE-2007-6427.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server and Xfont library, allowing for a local privilege escalation and arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2007-6427.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2007-6427.body: regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extension via iDefense:
CVE-2007-6427.extra: Remote attackers could exploit the vulnerability in the Xfont library by enticing a user to load a specially crafted PCF font file resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the X server, typically root. Local attackers could exploit this and the vulnerabilities in the X.org extensions to gain elevated privileges. If the X server allows connections from the network, these vulnerabilities could be exploited remotely. A local attacker could determine the existence of arbitrary files by exploiting the last vulnerability or possibly cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6427.title: NX: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-05
CVE-2007-6427.subTitle: NX uses code from the X.org X11 server which is prone to multiple vulnerabilities.
CVE-2007-6427.background: NoMachine's NX establishes remote connections to X11 desktops over small bandwidth links. NX and NX Node are the compression core libraries, whereas NX is used by FreeNX and NX Node by the binary-only NX servers.
CVE-2007-6427.body: Multiple integer overflow and buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server as shipped by NX and NX Node (vulnerabilities 1-4 in GLSA 200801-09).
CVE-2007-6427.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities via unspecified vectors, leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user on the machine running the NX server.

CVE-2007-6430.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-13
CVE-2007-6430.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for SQL injection, session hijacking and unauthorized usage.
CVE-2007-6430.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and tool kit.
CVE-2007-6430.body: Asterisk upstream developers reported multiple vulnerabilities:
CVE-2007-6430.extra: Remote authenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk to execute arbitrary SQL commands and compromise the administrative database. Remote unauthenticated attackers could bypass authentication using a valid username to hijack other user's sessions, and establish sessions on the SIP channel without authentication.

CVE-2007-6437.title: Syslog-ng: Denial of service — GLSA 200712-19
CVE-2007-6437.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been discovered in Syslog-ng.
CVE-2007-6437.background: Syslog-ng is a flexible and scalable system logger.
CVE-2007-6437.body: Oriol Carreras reported a NULL pointer dereference in the log_msg_parse() function when processing timestamps without a terminating whitespace character.
CVE-2007-6437.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted event to a vulnerable Syslog-ng server, resulting in a crash.

CVE-2007-6438.title: Wireshark: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-23
CVE-2007-6438.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6438.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2007-6438.body: Multiple buffer overflows and infinite loops were discovered in multiple dissector and parser components, including those for MP3 and NCP (CVE-2007-6111), PPP (CVE-2007-6112), DNP (CVE-2007-6113), SSL and iSeries (OS/400) Communication traces (CVE-2007-6114), ANSI MAP (CVE-2007-6115), Firebird/Interbase (CVE-2007-6116), HTTP (CVE-2007-6117), MEGACO (CVE-2007-6118), DCP ETSI (CVE-2007-6119), Bluetooth SDP (CVE-2007-6120), RPC Portmap (CVE-2007-6121), SMB (CVE-2007-6438), IPv6 amd USB (CVE-2007-6439), WiMAX (CVE-2007-6441), RPL (CVE-2007-6450), CIP (CVE-2007-6451). The vulnerabilities were discovered by Stefan Esser, Beyond Security, Fabiodds, Peter Leeming, Steve and ainsley.
CVE-2007-6438.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted packets on a network being monitored with Wireshark or entice a user to open a specially crafted file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Wireshark (which might be the root user), or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2007-6520.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200712-22
CVE-2007-6520.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Opera, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code and cross domain scripting.
CVE-2007-6520.background: Opera is a fast Web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2007-6520.body: David Bloom reported two vulnerabilities where plug-ins (CVE-2007-6520) and Rich text editing (CVE-2007-6522) could be used to allow cross domain scripting. Alexander Klink (Cynops GmbH) discovered an issue with TLS certificates (CVE-2007-6521). Gynvael Coldwind reported that bitmaps might reveal random data from memory (CVE-2007-6524).
CVE-2007-6520.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code and cross domain scripting.

CVE-2007-6526.title: TikiWiki: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-10
CVE-2007-6526.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in TikiWiki, some of them having unknown impact.
CVE-2007-6526.background: TikiWiki is an open source content management system written in PHP.
CVE-2007-6526.body: A remote attacker can craft the "movies" parameter to run a directory traversal attack through a ".." sequence and read the first 1000 bytes of any arbitrary file, or conduct a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack through the "area_name" parameter. This attack can be exploited to execute arbitrary HTML and script code in a user's browser session, allowing for the theft of browser session data or cookies in the context of the affected web site. The impacts of the unspecified vulnerabilities are still unknown.
CVE-2007-6526.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2007-6531.title: Xfce: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-06
CVE-2007-6531.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Xfce might allow user-assisted attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-6531.background: Xfce is a GTK+ 2 based desktop environment that allows to run a modern desktop environment on modest hardware.
CVE-2007-6531.body: Gregory Andersen reported that the Xfce4 panel does not correctly calculate memory boundaries, leading to a stack-based buffer overflow in the launcher_update_panel_entry() function (CVE-2007-6531). Daichi Kawahata reported libxfcegui4 did not copy provided values when creating "SessionClient" structs, possibly leading to access of freed memory areas (CVE-2007-6532).
CVE-2007-6531.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to install a specially crafted "rc" file to execute arbitrary code via long strings in the "Name" and "Comment" fields or via unspecified vectors involving the second vulnerability.

Daichi Kawahata reported libxfcegui4 did not copy provided values when creating "SessionClient" structs, possibly leading to access of freed memory areas (CVE-2007-6532).
CVE-2007-6532.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to install a specially crafted "rc" file to execute arbitrary code via long strings in the "Name" and "Comment" fields or via unspecified vectors involving the second vulnerability.

CVE-2007-6561.title: PDFlib: Multiple buffer overflows — GLSA 200803-17
CVE-2007-6561.subTitle: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows have been reported in PDFlib.
CVE-2007-6561.background: PDFlib is a library for generating PDF on the fly.
CVE-2007-6561.body: poplix reported multiple boundary errors in the pdc_fsearch_fopen() function when processing overly long filenames.
CVE-2007-6561.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted content to a vulnerable application using PDFlib, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2007-6600.title: PostgreSQL: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-15
CVE-2007-6600.subTitle: PostgreSQL contains multiple vulnerabilities that could result in privilege escalation or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2007-6600.background: PostgreSQL is an open source object-relational database management system.
CVE-2007-6600.body: If using the "expression indexes" feature, PostgreSQL executes index functions as the superuser during VACUUM and ANALYZE instead of the table owner, and allows SET ROLE and SET SESSION AUTHORIZATION in the index functions (CVE-2007-6600). Additionally, several errors involving regular expressions were found (CVE-2007-4769, CVE-2007-4772, CVE-2007-6067). Eventually, a privilege escalation vulnerability via unspecified vectors in the DBLink module was reported (CVE-2007-6601). This vulnerability is exploitable when local trust or ident authentication is used, and is due to an incomplete fix of CVE-2007-3278.
CVE-2007-6600.extra: A remote authenticated attacker could send specially crafted queries containing complex regular expressions to the server that could result in a Denial of Service by a server crash (CVE-2007-4769), an infinite loop (CVE-2007-4772) or a memory exhaustion (CVE-2007-6067). The two other vulnerabilities can be exploited to gain additional privileges.

This vulnerability is exploitable when local trust or ident authentication is used, and is due to an incomplete fix of CVE-2007-3278.
CVE-2007-6601.extra: A remote authenticated attacker could send specially crafted queries containing complex regular expressions to the server that could result in a Denial of Service by a server crash (CVE-2007-4769), an infinite loop (CVE-2007-4772) or a memory exhaustion (CVE-2007-6067). The two other vulnerabilities can be exploited to gain additional privileges.

CVE-2007-6611.title: Mantis: Cross-Site Scripting — GLSA 200803-04
CVE-2007-6611.subTitle: A persistent Cross-Site Scripting vulnerability has been discovered in Mantis.
CVE-2007-6611.background: Mantis is a web-based bug tracking system.
CVE-2007-6611.body: seiji reported that the filename for the uploaded file in bug_report.php is not properly sanitised before being stored.
CVE-2007-6611.extra: A remote attacker could upload a file with a specially crafted to a bug report, resulting in the execution of arbitrary HTML and script code within the context of the users's browser. Note that this vulnerability is only exploitable by authenticated users.

CVE-2007-6613.title: libcdio: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200801-08
CVE-2007-6613.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in libcdio.
CVE-2007-6613.background: libcdio is a library for accessing CD-ROM and CD images.
CVE-2007-6613.body: Devon Miller reported a boundary error in the "print_iso9660_recurse()" function in files cd-info.c and iso-info.c when processing long filenames within Joliet images.
CVE-2007-6613.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted ISO image in the cd-info and iso-info applications, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Applications linking against shared libraries of libcdio are not affected.

CVE-2007-6681.title: VLC: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-25
CVE-2007-6681.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in VLC, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2007-6681.background: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.
CVE-2007-6681.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in VLC:
CVE-2007-6681.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file or stream, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2007-6685.title: Gallery: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200802-04
CVE-2007-6685.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Gallery.
CVE-2007-6685.background: Gallery is a web-based application for creating and viewing photo albums.
CVE-2007-6685.body: The Gallery developement team reported and fixed critical vulnerabilities during an internal audit (CVE-2007-6685, CVE-2007-6686, CVE-2007-6687, CVE-2007-6688, CVE-2007-6689, CVE-2007-6690, CVE-2007-6691, CVE-2007-6692, CVE-2007-6693).
CVE-2007-6685.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code, conduct Cross-Site Scripting and Cross-Site Request Forgery attacks, or disclose sensitive informations.
